name: AbstractRange
overview: ["The AbstractRange abstract interface is the base class upon which all DOM range types are defined. A range is an object that indicates the start and end points of a section of content within the document.","As an abstract interface, you will not directly instantiate an object of type AbstractRange. Instead, you will use the Range or StaticRange interfaces. To understand the difference between those two interfaces, and how to choose which is appropriate for your needs."]

properties.name: collapsed
properties.overview: A Boolean value which is true if the range is collapsed. A collapsed range is one whose start position and end position are the same, resulting in a zero-character-long range.

properties.name: endContainer
properties.overview: The DOM Node in which the end of the range, as specified by the endOffset property, is located.

properties.name: endOffset
properties.overview: An integer value indicating the offset, in characters, from the beginning of the node's contents to the beginning of the range represented by the range object. This value must be less than the length of the endContainer node.

properties.name: startContainer
properties.overview: The DOM Node in which the beginning of the range, as specified by the startOffset property, is located.

properties.name: startOffset
properties.overview: An integer value indicating the offset, in characters, from the beginning of the node's contents to the last character of the contents referred to  by the range object. This value must be less than the length of the node indicated in startContainer.

name: Attr
overview: ["The Attr interface represents one of a DOM element's attributes as an object. In most DOM methods, you will directly retrieve the attribute as a string (e.g., Element.getAttribute()), but certain functions (e.g., Element.getAttributeNode()) or means of iterating return Attr types."]

properties.name: localName
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the local part of the qualified name of the attribute.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: The attribute's name.

properties.name: namespaceURI
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the namespace URI of the attribute, or null if there is no namespace.

properties.name: ownerElement
properties.overview:
The element holding the attribute.

Note: DOM Level 4 removed this property. The assumption was that since you get an Attr object from an Element, you should already know the associated element.
As that doesn't hold true in cases like Attr objects being returned by Document.evaluate, the DOM Living Standard reintroduced the property.

Gecko outputs a deprecation note starting from Gecko 7.0 (Firefox 7.0 / Thunderbird 7.0 / SeaMonkey 2.4). This note was removed again in Gecko 49.0 (Firefox 49.0 / Thunderbird 49.0 / SeaMonkey 2.46).

properties.name: prefix
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the namespace prefix of the attribute, or null if no prefix is specified.

properties.name: specified
properties.overview: This property always returns true. Originally, it returned true if the attribute was explicitly specified in the source code or by a script, and false if its value came from the default one defined in the document's DTD.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: The attribute's value.

name: AudioTrack
overview: ["The AudioTrack interface represents a single audio track from one of the HTML media elements, element is used to embed sound content in documents. It may contain one or more audio sources, represented using the src attribute or the element: the browser will choose the most suitable one. It can also be the destination for streamed media, using a MediaStream.\"><audio> or ) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document. You can use . The most common use for accessing an AudioTrack object is to toggle its enabled property in order to mute and unmute the track."]

properties.name: enabled
properties.overview: A Boolean value which controls whether or not the audio track's sound is enabled. Setting this value to false mutes the track's audio.

properties.name: id
properties.overview: A DOMString which uniquely identifies the track within the media. This ID can be used to locate a specific track within an audio track list by calling AudioTrackList.getTrackById(). The ID can also be used as the fragment part of the URL if the media supports seeking by media fragment per the Media Fragments URI specification.

properties.name: kind
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the category into which the track falls. For example, the main audio track would have a kind of "main".

properties.name: label
properties.overview: A DOMString providing a human-readable label for the track. For example, an audio commentary track for a movie might have a label of "Commentary with director John Q. Public and actors John Doe and Jane Eod." This string is empty if no label is provided.

properties.name: language
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the audio track's primary language, or an empty string if unknown. The language is specified as a BCP 47 (RFC 5646) language code, such as "en-US" or "pt-BR".

name: AudioTrackList
overview: ["The AudioTrackList interface is used to represent a list of the audio tracks contained within a given HTML media element, with each track represented by a separate or object in the list.","Retrieve an instance of this object with HTMLMediaElement.audioTracks. The individual tracks can be accessed using array syntax."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: The number of tracks in the list.

properties.name: onaddtrack
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the addtrack event is fired, indicating that a new audio track has been added to the media element.

properties.name: onchange
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the change event occurs. This occurs when one or more tracks have been enabled or disabled by their enabled flag being changed.

properties.name: onremovetrack
properties.overview: An event handler to call when the removetrack event is sent, indicating that an audio track has been removed from the media element.

methods.name: getTrackById
methods.overview: Returns the AudioTrack found within the AudioTrackList whose id matches the specified string. If no match is found, null is returned.

name: Blob
overview: ["The Blob object represents a blob, which is a file-like object of immutable, raw data; they can be read as text or binary data, or converted into a ReadableStream so its methods can be used for processing the data.","Blobs can represent data that isn't necessarily in a JavaScript-native format. The File interface is based on Blob, inheriting blob functionality and expanding it to support files on the user's system."]

properties.name: size
properties.overview: The size, in bytes, of the data contained in the Blob object.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: A string indicating the MIME type of the data contained in the Blob. If the type is unknown, this string is empty.

methods.name: arrayBuffer
methods.overview: Returns a promise that resolves with an ArrayBuffer containing the entire contents of the Blob as binary data.

methods.name: slice
methods.overview: Returns a new Blob object containing the data in the specified range of bytes of the blob on which it's called.

methods.name: stream
methods.overview: Returns a ReadableStream that can be used to read the contents of the Blob.

methods.name: text
methods.overview: Returns a promise that resolves with a USVString containing the entire contents of the Blob interpreted as UTF-8 text.

name: CDATASection
overview: ["The CDATASection interface represents a CDATA section that can be used within XML to include extended portions of unescaped text. The symbols < and & don’t need escaping as they normally do when inside a CDATA section.","In XML, a CDATA section looks like:"]

name: CSSRule
overview: ["The CSSRule interface represents a single CSS rule. There are several types of rules, listed in the Type constants section below.","The CSSRule interface specifies the properties common to all rules, while properties unique to specific rule types are specified in the more specialized interfaces for those rules' respective types.","References to a CSSRule may be obtained by looking at a CSSStyleSheet's cssRules list."]

properties.name: cssText
properties.overview: Represents the textual representation of the rule, e.g. "h1,h2 { font-size: 16pt }" or "@import 'url'". To access or modify parts of the rule (e.g. the value of "font-size" in the example) use the properties on the specialized interface for the rule's type.

properties.name: parentRule
properties.overview: Returns the containing rule, otherwise null. E.g. if this rule is a style rule inside an @media block, the parent rule would be that CSSMediaRule.

properties.name: parentStyleSheet
properties.overview: Returns the CSSStyleSheet object for the style sheet that contains this rule

properties.name: type
properties.overview: One of the Type constants indicating the type of CSS rule.

name: CSSRuleList
overview: ["A CSSRuleList is an (indirect-modify only) array-like object containing an ordered collection of CSSRule objects."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: Returns the number of items in the collection.

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Returns the specific node at the given zero-based index into the list. Returns null if the index is out of range.

name: CSSStyleDeclaration
overview: ["The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents an object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.","A CSSStyleDeclaration object can be exposed using three different APIs:"]

properties.name: cssFloat
properties.overview: The cssFloat attribute can be set for elements that generate boxes that are not absolutely positioned. The cssFloat attribute corresponds to the float Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) property. Getting this attribute is equivalent to calling the getProperty method. Setting this attribute is equivalent to calling the setProperty method.

properties.name: cssText
properties.overview: Textual representation of the declaration block. Setting this attribute changes the style.

properties.name: length
properties.overview: The number of properties. See the item() method below.

properties.name: parentRule
properties.overview: The containing CSSRule.

methods.name: getPropertyPriority
methods.overview: Returns the optional priority, "important".

methods.name: getPropertyValue
methods.overview: Returns the property value given a property name.

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Returns a property name.

methods.name: removeProperty
methods.overview: Removes a property from the CSS declaration block.

methods.name: setProperty
methods.overview: Modifies an existing CSS property or creates a new CSS property in the declaration block.

name: CSSStyleSheet
overview: ["The CSSStyleSheet interface represents a single CSS stylesheet, and lets you inspect and modify the list of rules contained in the stylesheet. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, StyleSheet.","A stylesheet consists of a collection of CSSRule objects representing each of the rules in the stylesheet. The rules are contained in a CSSRuleList, which can be obtained from the stylesheet's cssRules property.","For example, one rule might be a CSSStyleRule object containing a style such as:"]

properties.name: cssRules
properties.overview:
Returns a live CSSRuleList which maintains an up-to-date list of the CSSRule objects that comprise the stylesheet.

This is normally used to access individual rules like this:

styleSheet.cssRules[i] // where i = 0..cssRules.length-1

To add or remove items in cssRules, use the CSSStyleSheet's insertRule() and deleteRule() methods.

properties.name: ownerRule
properties.overview: If this stylesheet is imported into the document using an @import rule, the ownerRule property returns the corresponding CSSImportRule; otherwise, this property's value is null.

methods.name: deleteRule
methods.overview: Deletes the rule at the specified index into the stylesheet's rule list.

methods.name: insertRule
methods.overview: Inserts a new rule at the specified position in the stylesheet, given the textual representation of the rule.

name: CharacterData
overview: ["The CharacterData abstract interface represents a Node object that contains characters. This is an abstract interface, meaning there aren't any object of type CharacterData: it is implemented by other interfaces, like Text, Comment, or ProcessingInstruction which aren't abstract."]

properties.name: data
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the textual data contained in this object.

properties.name: length
properties.overview: Returns an unsigned long representing the size of the string contained in CharacterData.data.

methods.name: appendData
methods.overview: Appends the given DOMString to the CharacterData.data string; when this method returns, data contains the concatenated DOMString.

methods.name: deleteData
methods.overview: Removes the specified amount of characters, starting at the specified offset, from the CharacterData.data string; when this method returns, data contains the shortened DOMString.

methods.name: insertData
methods.overview: Inserts the specified characters, at the specified offset, in the CharacterData.data string; when this method returns, data contains the modified DOMString.

methods.name: replaceData
methods.overview: Replaces the specified amount of characters, starting at the specified offset, with the specified DOMString; when this method returns, data contains the modified DOMString.

methods.name: substringData
methods.overview: Returns a DOMString containing the part of CharacterData.data of the specified length and starting at the specified offset.

name: ChildNode
overview: ["The ChildNode mixin contains methods and properties that are common to all types of Node objects that can have a parent. It's implemented by Element, DocumentType, and CharacterData objects."]

methods.name: after
methods.overview: Inserts a set of Node or DOMString objects in the children list of this ChildNode's parent, just after this ChildNode. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.

methods.name: before
methods.overview: Inserts a set of Node or DOMString objects in the children list of this ChildNode's parent, just before this ChildNode. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.

methods.name: remove
methods.overview: Removes this ChildNode from the children list of its parent.

methods.name: replaceWith
methods.overview: Replaces this ChildNode in the children list of its parent with a set of Node or DOMString objects. DOMString objects are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.

name: Comment
overview: ["The Comment interface represents textual notations within markup; although it is generally not visually shown, such comments are available to be read in the source view. Comments are represented in HTML and XML as content between '<!--' and '-->'. In XML, the character sequence '--' cannot be used within a comment."]

name: DOMException
overview: ["The DOMException interface represents an abnormal event (called an exception) which occurs as a result of calling a method or accessing a property of a web API. This is basically how error conditions are described in web APIs.","Each exception has a name, which is a short \"CamelCase\" style string identifying the error or abnormal condition."]

properties.name: code
properties.overview: Returns a short that contains one of the error code constants, or 0 if none match. This field is used for historical reasons. New DOM exceptions don't use this anymore: they put this info in the DOMException.name attribute.

properties.name: message
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString representing a message or description associated with the given error name.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString that contains one of the strings associated with an error name.

name: DOMImplementation
overview: ["The DOMImplementation interface represents an object providing methods which are not dependent on any particular document. Such an object is returned by the Document.implementation property."]

methods.name: createDocument
methods.overview: Creates and returns an XMLDocument.

methods.name: createDocumentType
methods.overview: Creates and returns a DocumentType.

methods.name: createHTMLDocument
methods.overview: Creates and returns an HTML Document.

methods.name: hasFeature
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating if a given feature is supported or not. This function is unreliable and kept for compatibility purpose alone: except for SVG-related queries, it always returns true. Old browsers are very inconsistent in their behavior.

name: DOMParser
overview: ["The DOMParser interface provides the ability to parse XML or HTML source code from a string into a DOM Document."]

methods.name: parseFromString
methods.overview: Parse XML from a string

name: DOMRect
overview:
["Draft
\n This page is not complete."]

properties.name: height
properties.overview: The height of the DOMRect.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: The width of the DOMRect.

properties.name: x
properties.overview: The x coordinate of the DOMRect's origin.

properties.name: y
properties.overview: The y coordinate of the DOMRect's origin.

methods.name: fromRect
methods.overview: Creates a new DOMRect object with a given location and dimensions.

name: DOMRectReadOnly
overview: ["The DOMRectReadOnly interface specifies the standard properties used by DOMRect to define a rectangle whose properties are immutable."]

properties.name: bottom
properties.overview: Returns the bottom coordinate value of the DOMRect (usually the same as y + height).

properties.name: height
properties.overview: The height of the DOMRect.

properties.name: left
properties.overview: Returns the left coordinate value of the DOMRect (usually the same as x).

properties.name: right
properties.overview: Returns the right coordinate value of the DOMRect (usually the same as x + width).

properties.name: top
properties.overview: Returns the top coordinate value of the DOMRect (usually the same as y.)

properties.name: width
properties.overview: The width of the DOMRect.

properties.name: x
properties.overview: The x coordinate of the DOMRect's origin.

properties.name: y
properties.overview: The y coordinate of the DOMRect's origin.

methods.name: fromRect
methods.overview: Creates a new DOMRect object with a given location and dimensions.

name: DOMStringMap
overview: ["Used by the HTMLElement.dataset attribute to represent data for custom attributes added to elements."]

name: DOMTokenList
overview: ["The DOMTokenList interface represents a set of space-separated tokens. Such a set is returned by Element.classList, element and the current document.\">HTMLLinkElement.relList, element and the current document.\">HTMLAnchorElement.relList, element and the current document.\">HTMLAreaElement.relList, HTMLIframeElement.sandbox, or HTMLOutputElement.htmlFor. It is indexed beginning with 0 as with JavaScript Array objects. DOMTokenList is always case-sensitive."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: Is an integer representing the number of objects stored in the object.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: A stringifier property that returns the value of the list as a DOMString.

methods.name: add
methods.overview: Adds the specified token(s) to the list.

methods.name: contains
methods.overview: Returns true if the list contains the given token, otherwise false.

methods.name: entries
methods.overview: Returns an iterator, allowing you to go through all key/value pairs contained in this object.

methods.name: forEach
methods.overview: Executes a provided callback function once per DOMTokenList element.

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Returns the item in the list by its index, or undefined if index is greater than or equal to the list's length.

methods.name: keys
methods.overview: Returns an iterator, allowing you to go through all keys of the key/value pairs contained in this object.

methods.name: remove
methods.overview: Removes the specified token(s) from the list.

methods.name: replace
methods.overview: Replaces token with newToken.

methods.name: supports
methods.overview: Returns true if a given token is in the associated attribute's supported tokens.

methods.name: toggle
methods.overview: Removes token from the list if it exists, or adds token to the list if it doesn't. Returns a boolean indicating whether token is in the list after the operation.

methods.name: values
methods.overview: Returns an iterator, allowing you to go through all values of the key/value pairs contained in this object.

name: Document
overview: ["The Document interface represents any web page loaded in the browser and serves as an entry point into the web page's content, which is the DOM tree. The DOM tree includes elements such as Element represents the content of an HTML document. There can be only one element in a document.\"><body> and element represents tabular data — that is, information presented in a two-dimensional table comprised of rows and columns of cells containing data.\"><table>, among many others. It provides functionality globally to the document, like how to obtain the page's URL and create new elements in the document."]

properties.name: anchors
properties.overview: Returns a list of all of the anchors in the document.

properties.name: body
properties.overview: Returns the <body> or <frameset> node of the current document.

properties.name: characterSet
properties.overview: Returns the character set being used by the document.

properties.name: compatMode
properties.overview: Indicates whether the document is rendered in quirks or strict mode.

properties.name: contentType
properties.overview: Returns the Content-Type from the MIME Header of the current document.

properties.name: cookie
properties.overview: Returns a semicolon-separated list of the cookies for that document or sets a single cookie.

properties.name: defaultView
properties.overview: Returns a reference to the window object.

properties.name: designMode
properties.overview: Gets/sets the ability to edit the whole document.

properties.name: dir
properties.overview: Gets/sets directionality (rtl/ltr) of the document.

properties.name: doctype
properties.overview: Returns the Document Type Definition (DTD) of the current document.

properties.name: documentElement
properties.overview: Returns the Element that is a direct child of the document. For HTML documents, this is normally the HTMLHtmlElement object representing the document's <html> element.

properties.name: documentURI
properties.overview: Returns the document location as a string.

properties.name: domain
properties.overview: Gets/sets the domain of the current document.

properties.name: embeds
properties.overview: Returns a list of the embedded <embed> elements within the current document.

properties.name: featurePolicy
properties.overview: Returns the FeaturePolicy interface which provides a simple API for introspecting the feature policies applied to a specific document.

properties.name: fonts
properties.overview: Returns the FontFaceSet interface of the current document.

properties.name: forms
properties.overview: Returns a list of the <form> elements within the current document.

properties.name: fullscreenEnabled
properties.overview: Indicates whether or not full-screen mode is available.

properties.name: head
properties.overview: Returns the <head> element of the current document.

properties.name: hidden
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean value indicating if the page is considered hidden or not.

properties.name: images
properties.overview: Returns a list of the images in the current document.

properties.name: implementation
properties.overview: Returns the DOM implementation associated with the current document.

properties.name: lastModified
properties.overview: Returns the date on which the document was last modified.

properties.name: links
properties.overview: Returns a list of all the hyperlinks in the document.

properties.name: location
properties.overview: Returns the URI of the current document.

properties.name: onfullscreenchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the fullscreenchange event is raised.

properties.name: onfullscreenerror
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the fullscreenerror event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerlockchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerlockchange event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerlockerror
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerlockerror event is raised.

properties.name: onreadystatechange
properties.overview: Represents the event handling code for the readystatechange event.

properties.name: onvisibilitychange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the visibilitychange event is raised.

properties.name: plugins
properties.overview: Returns a list of the available plugins.

properties.name: readyState
properties.overview: Returns loading status of the document.

properties.name: referrer
properties.overview: Returns the URI of the page that linked to this page.

properties.name: scripts
properties.overview: Returns all the <script> elements on the document.

properties.name: scrollingElement
properties.overview: Returns a reference to the Element that scrolls the document.

properties.name: title
properties.overview: Sets or gets the title of the current document.

properties.name: URL
properties.overview: Returns the document location as a string.

properties.name: visibilityState
properties.overview: Returns a string denoting the visibility state of the document. Possible values are visible, hidden, prerender, and unloaded.

methods.name: adoptNode
methods.overview: Adopt node from an external document.

methods.name: captureEvents
methods.overview: See Window.captureEvents.

methods.name: close
methods.overview: Closes a document stream for writing.

methods.name: createAttribute
methods.overview: Creates a new Attr object and returns it.

methods.name: createAttributeNS
methods.overview: Creates a new attribute node in a given namespace and returns it.

methods.name: createCDATASection
methods.overview: Creates a new CDATA node and returns it.

methods.name: createComment
methods.overview: Creates a new comment node and returns it.

methods.name: createDocumentFragment
methods.overview: Creates a new document fragment.

methods.name: createElement
methods.overview: Creates a new element with the given tag name.

methods.name: createElementNS
methods.overview: Creates a new element with the given tag name and namespace URI.

methods.name: createEvent
methods.overview: Creates an event object.

methods.name: createNodeIterator
methods.overview: Creates a NodeIterator object.

methods.name: createProcessingInstruction
methods.overview: Creates a new ProcessingInstruction object.

methods.name: createRange
methods.overview: Creates a Range object.

methods.name: createTextNode
methods.overview: Creates a text node.

methods.name: createTreeWalker
methods.overview: Creates a TreeWalker object.

methods.name: exitFullscreen
methods.overview: Requests that the element on this document which is currently being presented in full-screen mode be taken out of full-screen mode, restoring the previous state of the screen.

methods.name: exitPointerLock
methods.overview: Release the pointer lock.

methods.name: getElementsByClassName
methods.overview: Returns a list of elements with the given class name.

methods.name: getElementsByName
methods.overview: Returns a list of elements with the given name.

methods.name: getElementsByTagName
methods.overview: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name.

methods.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
methods.overview: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name and namespace.

methods.name: getSelection
methods.overview: Returns a Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user, or the current position of the caret.

methods.name: hasFocus
methods.overview: Returns true if the focus is currently located anywhere inside the specified document.

methods.name: importNode
methods.overview: Returns a clone of a node from an external document.

methods.name: open
methods.overview: Opens a document stream for writing.

methods.name: releaseEvents
methods.overview: See Window.releaseEvents().

methods.name: write
methods.overview: Writes text in a document.

methods.name: writeln
methods.overview: Writes a line of text in a document.

name: DocumentFragment
overview: ["The DocumentFragment interface represents a minimal document object that has no parent. It is used as a lightweight version of Document that stores a segment of a document structure comprised of nodes just like a standard document. The key difference is due to the fact that the document fragment isn't part of the active document tree structure. Changes made to the fragment don't affect the document (even on reflow) or incur any performance impact when changes are made."]

name: DocumentOrShadowRoot
overview: ["The DocumentOrShadowRoot mixin of the Shadow DOM API provides APIs that are shared between documents and shadow roots. The following features are included in both Document and ShadowRoot. "]

properties.name: activeElement
properties.overview: Returns the Element within the shadow tree that has focus.

properties.name: fullscreenElement
properties.overview: Returns the Element that's currently in full screen mode for this document.

properties.name: pointerLockElement
properties.overview: Returns the element set as the target for mouse events while the pointer is locked. It returns null if lock is pending, the pointer is unlocked, or if the target is in another document.

methods.name: caretPositionFromPoint
methods.overview: Returns a CaretPosition object containing the DOM node containing the caret, and caret's character offset within that node.

methods.name: elementFromPoint
methods.overview: Returns the topmost element at the specified coordinates.

methods.name: elementsFromPoint
methods.overview: Returns an array of all elements at the specified coordinates.

methods.name: getSelection
methods.overview: Returns a Selection object representing the range of text selected by the user, or the current position of the caret.

name: DocumentType
overview: ["The DocumentType interface represents a Node containing a doctype."]

properties.name: name
properties.overview: A DOMString, eg "html" for <!DOCTYPE HTML>.

properties.name: publicId
properties.overview: A DOMString, eg "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN", empty string for HTML5.

properties.name: systemId
properties.overview: A DOMString, eg "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd", empty string for HTML5.

name: Element
overview: ["Element is the most general base class from which all element objects (i.e. objects that represent elements) in a Document inherit. It only has methods and properties common to all kinds of elements. More specific classes inherit from Element. For example, the HTMLElement interface is the base interface for HTML elements, while the SVGElement interface is the basis for all SVG elements. Most functionality is specified further down the class hierarchy.","Languages outside the realm of the Web platform, like XUL through the XULElement interface, also implement Element."]

properties.name: attributes
properties.overview: Returns a NamedNodeMap object containing the assigned attributes of the corresponding HTML element.

properties.name: classList
properties.overview: Returns a DOMTokenList containing the list of class attributes.

properties.name: className
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the class of the element.

properties.name: clientHeight
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the inner height of the element.

properties.name: clientLeft
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the width of the left border of the element.

properties.name: clientTop
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the width of the top border of the element.

properties.name: clientWidth
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the inner width of the element.

properties.name: id
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the id of the element.

properties.name: innerHTML
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the markup of the element's content.

properties.name: localName
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the local part of the qualified name of the element.

properties.name: namespaceURI
properties.overview:
The namespace URI of the element, or null if it is no namespace.

Note: In Firefox 3.5 and earlier, HTML elements are in no namespace. In later versions, HTML elements are in the http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml namespace in both HTML and XML trees.

properties.name: onfullscreenchange
properties.overview: An event handler for the fullscreenchange event, which is sent when the element enters or exits full-screen mode. This can be used to watch both for successful expected transitions, but also to watch for unexpected changes, such as when your app is running in the background.

properties.name: onfullscreenerror
properties.overview: An event handler for the fullscreenerror event, which is sent when an error occurs while attempting to change into full-screen mode.

properties.name: outerHTML
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the markup of the element including its content. When used as a setter, replaces the element with nodes parsed from the given string.

properties.name: part
properties.overview: Represents the part identifier(s) of the element (i.e. set using the part attribute), returned as a DOMTokenList.

properties.name: prefix
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the namespace prefix of the element, or null if no prefix is specified.

properties.name: scrollHeight
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the scroll view height of an element.

properties.name: scrollLeft
properties.overview: Is a Number representing the left scroll offset of the element.

properties.name: scrollTop
properties.overview: A Number representing number of pixels the top of the document is scrolled vertically.

properties.name: scrollWidth
properties.overview: Returns a Number representing the scroll view width of the element.

properties.name: shadowRoot
properties.overview: Returns the open shadow root that is hosted by the element, or null if no open shadow root is present.

properties.name: slot
properties.overview: Returns the name of the shadow DOM slot the element is inserted in.

properties.name: tagName
properties.overview: Returns a String with the name of the tag for the given element.

methods.name: attachShadow
methods.overview: Attaches a shadow DOM tree to the specified element and returns a reference to its ShadowRoot.

methods.name: closest
methods.overview: Returns the Element which is the closest ancestor of the current element (or the current element itself) which matches the selectors given in parameter.

methods.name: computedStyleMap
methods.overview: Returns a StylePropertyMapReadOnly interface which provides a read-only representation of a CSS declaration block that is an alternative to CSSStyleDeclaration.

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.overview: Retrieves the value of the named attribute from the current node and returns it as an Object.

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.overview: Returns an array of attribute names from the current element.

methods.name: getAttributeNode
methods.overview: Retrieves the node representation of the named attribute from the current node and returns it as an Attr.

methods.name: getAttributeNodeNS
methods.overview: Retrieves the node representation of the attribute with the specified name and namespace, from the current node and returns it as an Attr.

methods.name: getAttributeNS
methods.overview: Retrieves the value of the attribute with the specified name and namespace, from the current node and returns it as an Object.

methods.name: getBoundingClientRect
methods.overview: Returns the size of an element and its position relative to the viewport.

methods.name: getClientRects
methods.overview: Returns a collection of rectangles that indicate the bounding rectangles for each line of text in a client.

methods.name: getElementsByClassName
methods.overview: Returns a live HTMLCollection that contains all descendants of the current element that possess the list of classes given in the parameter.

methods.name: getElementsByTagName
methods.overview: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing all descendant elements, of a particular tag name, from the current element.

methods.name: getElementsByTagNameNS
methods.overview: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing all descendant elements, of a particular tag name and namespace, from the current element.

methods.name: hasAttribute
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating if the element has the specified attribute or not.

methods.name: hasAttributeNS
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating if the element has the specified attribute, in the specified namespace, or not.

methods.name: hasAttributes
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating if the element has one or more HTML attributes present.

methods.name: hasPointerCapture
methods.overview: Indicates whether the element on which it is invoked has pointer capture for the pointer identified by the given pointer ID.

methods.name: insertAdjacentElement
methods.overview: Inserts a given element node at a given position relative to the element it is invoked upon.

methods.name: insertAdjacentHTML
methods.overview: Parses the text as HTML or XML and inserts the resulting nodes into the tree in the position given.

methods.name: insertAdjacentText
methods.overview: Inserts a given text node at a given position relative to the element it is invoked upon.

methods.name: matches
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating whether or not the element would be selected by the specified selector string.

methods.name: releasePointerCapture
methods.overview: Releases (stops) pointer capture that was previously set for a specific pointer event.

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.overview: Removes the named attribute from the current node.

methods.name: removeAttributeNode
methods.overview: Removes the node representation of the named attribute from the current node.

methods.name: removeAttributeNS
methods.overview: Removes the attribute with the specified name and namespace, from the current node.

methods.name: requestFullscreen
methods.overview: Asynchronously asks the browser to make the element full-screen.

methods.name: requestPointerLock
methods.overview: Allows to asynchronously ask for the pointer to be locked on the given element.

methods.name: scroll
methods.overview: Scrolls to a particular set of coordinates inside a given element.

methods.name: scrollBy
methods.overview: Scrolls an element by the given amount.

methods.name: scrollIntoView
methods.overview: Scrolls the page until the element gets into the view.

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.overview: Scrolls to a particular set of coordinates inside a given element.

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.overview: Sets the value of a named attribute of the current node.

methods.name: setAttributeNode
methods.overview: Sets the node representation of the named attribute from the current node.

methods.name: setAttributeNodeNS
methods.overview: Sets the node representation of the attribute with the specified name and namespace, from the current node.

methods.name: setAttributeNS
methods.overview: Sets the value of the attribute with the specified name and namespace, from the current node.

methods.name: setPointerCapture
methods.overview: Designates a specific element as the capture target of future pointer events.

methods.name: toggleAttribute
methods.overview: Toggles a boolean attribute, removing it if it is present and adding it if it is not present, on the specified element.

name: Event
overview: ["The Event interface represents an event which takes place in the DOM.","An event can be triggered by the user action e.g. clicking the mouse button or tapping keyboard, or generated by APIs to represent the progress of an asynchronous task. It can also be triggered programmatically, such as by calling the HTMLElement.click() method of an element, or by defining the event, then sending it to a specified target using EventTarget.dispatchEvent().","There are many types of events, some of which use other interfaces based on the main Event interface. Event itself contains the properties and methods which are common to all events.","Many DOM elements can be set up to accept (or \"listen\" for) these events, and execute code in response to process (or \"handle\") them. Event-handlers are usually connected (or \"attached\") to various HTML elements (such as <button>, <div>, <span>, etc.) using EventTarget.addEventListener(), and this generally replaces using the old HTML event handler attributes. Further, when properly added, such handlers can also be disconnected if needed using removeEventListener()."]

properties.name: bubbles
properties.overview: A boolean indicating whether or not the event bubbles up through the DOM.

properties.name: cancelable
properties.overview: A boolean indicating whether the event is cancelable.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.overview: A historical alias to Event.stopPropagation(). Setting its value to true before returning from an event handler prevents propagation of the event.

properties.name: composed
properties.overview: A boolean indicating whether or not the event can bubble across the boundary between the shadow DOM and the regular DOM.

properties.name: currentTarget
properties.overview: A reference to the currently registered target for the event. This is the object to which the event is currently slated to be sent. It's possible this has been changed along the way through retargeting.

properties.name: defaultPrevented
properties.overview: Indicates whether or not the call to event.preventDefault() canceled the event.

properties.name: eventPhase
properties.overview: Indicates which phase of the event flow is being processed.

properties.name: isTrusted
properties.overview: Indicates whether or not the event was initiated by the browser (after a user click, for instance) or by a script (using an event creation method, like Event.initEvent).

properties.name: target
properties.overview: A reference to the target to which the event was originally dispatched.

properties.name: timeStamp
properties.overview: The time at which the event was created (in milliseconds). By specification, this value is time since epoch—but in reality, browsers' definitions vary. In addition, work is underway to change this to be a DOMHighResTimeStamp instead.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: The name of the event. Case-insensitive.

methods.name: composedPath
methods.overview: Returns the event’s path (objects on which listeners will be invoked). This does not include nodes in shadow trees if the shadow root was created with its ShadowRoot.mode closed.

methods.name: initEvent
methods.overview: Initializes the value of an Event created. If the event has already been dispatched, this method does nothing.

methods.name: preventDefault
methods.overview: Cancels the event (if it is cancelable).

methods.name: stopImmediatePropagation
methods.overview: For this particular event, prevent all other listeners from being called. This includes listeners attached to the same element as well as those attached to elements that will be traversed later (during the capture phase, for instance).

methods.name: stopPropagation
methods.overview: Stops the propagation of events further along in the DOM.

name: EventListener
overview: ["The EventListener interface represents an object that can handle an event dispatched by an EventTarget object."]

methods.name: handleEvent
methods.overview: A function that is called whenever an event of the specified type occurs.

name: EventTarget
overview: ["EventTarget is a DOM interface implemented by objects that can receive events and may have listeners for them.","Element, Document, and Window are the most common event targets, but other objects can be event targets too, for example XMLHttpRequest, AudioNode, AudioContext, and others.","Many event targets (including elements, documents, and windows) also support setting event handlers via onevent properties and attributes."]

methods.name: addEventListener
methods.overview: Registers an event handler of a specific event type on the EventTarget.

methods.name: dispatchEvent
methods.overview: Dispatches an event to this EventTarget.

methods.name: removeEventListener
methods.overview: Removes an event listener from the EventTarget.

name: File
overview: ["The File interface provides information about files and allows JavaScript in a web page to access their content.","File objects are generally retrieved from a element; this lets you access the list of files selected with the element. It's also used for a list of files dropped into web content when using the drag and drop API; see the DataTransfer object for details on this usage.\">FileList object returned as a result of a user selecting files using the  element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms in order to accept data from the user; a wide variety of types of input data and control widgets are available, depending on the device and user agent. \"><input> element, from a drag and drop operation's DataTransfer object, or from the mozGetAsFile() API on an  elements. The HTMLCanvasElement interface also inherits the properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface.\">HTMLCanvasElement.","A File object is a specific kind of a Blob, and can be used in any context that a Blob can. In particular, FileReader, URL.createObjectURL(), createImageBitmap(), and XMLHttpRequest.send() accept both Blobs and Files.","See Using files from web applications for more information and examples."]

properties.name: lastModified
properties.overview: Returns the last modified time of the file, in millisecond since the UNIX epoch (January 1st, 1970 at Midnight).

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Returns the name of the file referenced by the File object.

name: FileList
overview: ["An object of this type is returned by the files property of the HTML element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms in order to accept data from the user; a wide variety of types of input data and control widgets are available, depending on the device and user agent. \"><input> element; this lets you access the list of files selected with the <input type=\"file\"> element. It's also used for a list of files dropped into web content when using the drag and drop API; see the DataTransfer object for details on this usage."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: A read-only value indicating the number of files in the list.

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Returns a File object representing the file at the specified index in the file list.

name: GlobalEventHandlers
overview: ["The GlobalEventHandlers mixin describes the event handlers common to several interfaces like HTMLElement, Document, or Window. Each of these interfaces can, of course, add more event handlers in addition to the ones listed below."]

properties.name: onabort
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the abort event is raised.

properties.name: onanimationend
properties.overview: An EventHandler called when an animationend event is sent, indicating that a CSS animation has stopped playing.

properties.name: onanimationiteration
properties.overview: An EventHandler called when an animationiteration event has been sent, indicating that a CSS animation has begun playing a new iteration of the animation sequence.

properties.name: onanimationstart
properties.overview: An EventHandler called when an animationstart event is sent, indicating that a CSS animation has started playing.

properties.name: onauxclick
properties.overview: An EventHandler called when an auxclick event is sent, indicating that a non-primary button has been pressed on an input device (e.g. a middle mouse button).

properties.name: onblur
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the blur event is raised.

properties.name: oncancel
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the cancel event is raised.

properties.name: oncanplay
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the canplay event is raised.

properties.name: oncanplaythrough
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the canplaythrough event is raised.

properties.name: onchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the change event is raised.

properties.name: onclick
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the click event is raised.

properties.name: onclose
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the close event is raised.

properties.name: oncontextmenu
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the contextmenu event is raised.

properties.name: oncuechange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the cuechange event is raised.

properties.name: ondblclick
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dblclick event is raised.

properties.name: ondrag
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the drag event is raised.

properties.name: ondragend
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dragend event is raised.

properties.name: ondragenter
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dragenter event is raised.

properties.name: ondragleave
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dragleave event is raised.

properties.name: ondragover
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dragover event is raised.

properties.name: ondragstart
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the dragstart event is raised.

properties.name: ondrop
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the drop event is raised.

properties.name: ondurationchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the durationchange event is raised.

properties.name: onemptied
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the emptied event is raised.

properties.name: onended
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the ended event is raised.

properties.name: onerror
properties.overview: Is an OnErrorEventHandler representing the code to be called when the error event is raised.

properties.name: onfocus
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the focus event is raised.

properties.name: onformdata
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler for processing formdata events, fired after the entry list representing the form's data is constructed.

properties.name: ongotpointercapture
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the gotpointercapture event type is raised.

properties.name: oninput
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the input event is raised.

properties.name: oninvalid
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the invalid event is raised.

properties.name: onkeydown
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the keydown event is raised.

properties.name: onkeypress
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the keypress event is raised.

properties.name: onkeyup
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the keyup event is raised.

properties.name: onload
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the load event is raised.

properties.name: onloadeddata
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the loadeddata event is raised.

properties.name: onloadedmetadata
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the loadedmetadata event is raised.

properties.name: onloadstart
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the loadstart event is raised (when progress has begun on the loading of a resource.)

properties.name: onlostpointercapture
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the lostpointercapture event type is raised.

properties.name: onmousedown
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mousedown event is raised.

properties.name: onmouseenter
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mouseenter event is raised.

properties.name: onmouseleave
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mouseleave event is raised.

properties.name: onmousemove
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mousemove event is raised.

properties.name: onmouseout
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mouseout event is raised.

properties.name: onmouseover
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mouseover event is raised.

properties.name: onmouseup
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the mouseup event is raised.

properties.name: onpause
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pause event is raised.

properties.name: onplay
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the play event is raised.

properties.name: onplaying
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the playing event is raised.

properties.name: onpointercancel
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointercancel event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerdown
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerdown event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerenter
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerenter event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerleave
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerleave event is raised.

properties.name: onpointermove
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointermove event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerout
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerout event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerover
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerover event is raised.

properties.name: onpointerup
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the pointerup event is raised.

properties.name: onprogress
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the progress event is raised.

properties.name: onratechange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the ratechange event is raised.

properties.name: onreset
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the reset event is raised.

properties.name: onresize
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the resize event is raised.

properties.name: onscroll
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the scroll event is raised.

properties.name: onseeked
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the seeked event is raised.

properties.name: onseeking
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the seeking event is raised.

properties.name: onselect
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the select event is raised.

properties.name: onselectionchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the selectionchange event is raised, i.e. when the text selected on a web page changes.

properties.name: onselectstart
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the selectionchange event is raised, i.e. when the user starts to make a new text selection on a web page.

properties.name: onstalled
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the stalled event is raised.

properties.name: onsubmit
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the submit event is raised.

properties.name: onsuspend
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the suspend event is raised.

properties.name: ontimeupdate
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the timeupdate event is raised.

properties.name: ontouchcancel
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the touchcancel event is raised.

properties.name: ontouchend
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the touchend event is raised.

properties.name: ontouchmove
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the touchmove event is raised.

properties.name: ontouchstart
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the touchstart event is raised.

properties.name: ontransitionend
properties.overview: An EventHandler called when a transitionend event is sent, indicating that a CSS transition has finished playing.

properties.name: onvolumechange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the volumechange event is raised.

properties.name: onwaiting
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the waiting event is raised.

properties.name: onwheel
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the wheel event is raised.

name: HTMLAnchorElement
overview: ["The HTMLAnchorElement interface represents hyperlink elements and provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface that they inherit from) for manipulating the layout and presentation of such elements. This interface corresponds to <a> element; not to be confused with <link>, which is represented by HTMLLinkElement)"]

properties.name: download
properties.overview: Is a DOMString indicating that the linked resource is intended to be downloaded rather than displayed in the browser. The value represent the proposed name of the file. If the name is not a valid filename of the underlying OS, browser will adapt it.

properties.name: hreflang
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the hreflang HTML attribute, indicating the language of the linked resource.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use.

properties.name: rel
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the rel HTML attribute, specifying the relationship of the target object to the linked object.

properties.name: relList
properties.overview: Returns a DOMTokenList that reflects the rel HTML attribute, as a list of tokens.

properties.name: target
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the target HTML attribute, indicating where to display the linked resource.

properties.name: text
properties.overview: Is a DOMString being a synonym for the Node.textContent property.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the type HTML attribute, indicating the MIME type of the linked resource.

name: HTMLAreaElement
overview: ["The HTMLAreaElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular object HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element defines a hot-spot region on an image, and optionally associates it with a hypertext link. This element is used only within a element.\"><area> elements."]

properties.name: alt
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the alt HTML attribute, containing alternative text for the element.

properties.name: coords
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the coords HTML attribute, containing coordinates to define the hot-spot region.

properties.name: download
properties.overview: Is a DOMString indicating that the linked resource is intended to be downloaded rather than displayed in the browser. The value represent the proposed name of the file. If the name is not a valid filename of the underlying OS, browser will adapt it.

properties.name: hreflang
properties.overview: Is a DOMString containing that reflects the hreflang HTML attribute, indicating the language of the linked resource.

properties.name: noHref
properties.overview: Is a Boolean flag indicating if the area is inactive (true) or active (false).

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use when fetching the linked resource.

properties.name: rel
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the rel HTML attribute, indicating relationships of the current document to the linked resource.

properties.name: relList
properties.overview: Returns a DOMTokenList that reflects the rel HTML attribute, indicating relationships of the current document to the linked resource, as a list of tokens.

properties.name: shape
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the shape HTML attribute, indicating the shape of the hot-spot, limited to known values.

properties.name: target
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the target HTML attribute, indicating the browsing context in which to open the linked resource.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the type HTML attribute, indicating the MIME type of the linked resource.

name: HTMLAudioElement
overview: ["The HTMLAudioElement interface provides access to the properties of element is used to embed sound content in documents. It may contain one or more audio sources, represented using the src attribute or the element: the browser will choose the most suitable one. It can also be the destination for streamed media, using a MediaStream.\"><audio> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. It's based on, and inherits properties and methods from, the HTMLMediaElement interface."]

name: HTMLBRElement
overview: ["The HTMLBRElement interface represents a HTML line break element ( element produces a line break in text (carriage-return). It is useful for writing a poem or an address, where the division of lines is significant.\"><br>). It inherits from HTMLElement."]

name: HTMLBaseElement
overview: ["The HTMLBaseElement interface contains the base URI for a document. This object inherits all of the properties and methods as described in the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: href
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the href HTML attribute, containing a base URL for relative URLs in the document.

properties.name: target
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the target HTML attribute, containing a default target browsing context or frame for elements that do not have a target reference specified.

name: HTMLBodyElement
overview: ["The HTMLBodyElement interface provides special properties (beyond those inherited from the regular HTMLElement interface) for manipulating Element represents the content of an HTML document. There can be only one element in a document.\"><body> elements."]

properties.name: aLink
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the color of active hyperlinks.

properties.name: background
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the description of the location of the background image resource. Note that this is not an URI, though some older version of some browsers do expect it.

properties.name: bgColor
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the background color for the document.

properties.name: link
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the color of unvisited links.

properties.name: text
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the foreground color of text.

properties.name: vLink
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the color of visited links.

name: HTMLButtonElement
overview: ["The HTMLButtonElement interface provides properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating element represents a clickable button, which can be used in forms or anywhere in a document that needs simple, standard button functionality.\"><button> elements."]

properties.name: autofocus
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether or not the control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form-associated element in a document can have this attribute specified.

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether or not the control is disabled, meaning that it does not accept any clicks.

properties.name: form
properties.overview:
Is a HTMLFormElement reflecting the form that this button is associated with. If the button is a descendant of a form element, then this attribute is the ID of that form element.
If the button is not a descendant of a form element, then the attribute can be the ID of any form element in the same document it is related to, or the null value if none matches.

properties.name: formAction
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the URI of a resource that processes information submitted by the button. If specified, this attribute overrides the action attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

properties.name: formEnctype
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

properties.name: formMethod
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

properties.name: formNoValidate
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If specified, this attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

properties.name: formTarget
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the target attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: Is a NodeList that represents a list of <label> elements that are labels for this button.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the name of the object when submitted with a form. HTML5 If specified, it must not be the empty string.

properties.name: type
properties.overview:
Is a DOMString indicating the behavior of the button. This is an enumerated attribute with the following possible values:
  • "submit": The button submits the form. This is the default value if the attribute is not specified, HTML5 or if it is dynamically changed to an empty or invalid value.
  • "reset": The button resets the form.
  • "button": The button does nothing.
  • "menu": The button displays a menu.

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This attribute is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: Is a ValidityState representing the validity states that this button is in.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the current form control value of the button.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether the button is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation, including: its type property is reset or button; it has a datalist ancestor; or the disabled property is set to true.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Not supported for reset or button elements.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: Not supported for reset or button elements.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Not supported for reset or button elements.

name: HTMLCanvasElement
overview: ["The HTMLCanvasElement interface provides properties and methods for manipulating the layout and presentation of element with either the canvas scripting API or the WebGL API to draw graphics and animations.\"><canvas> elements. The HTMLCanvasElement interface also inherits the properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: height
properties.overview: Is a positive integer reflecting the height HTML attribute of the <canvas> element interpreted in CSS pixels. When the attribute is not specified, or if it is set to an invalid value, like a negative, the default value of 150 is used.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Is a positive integer reflecting the width HTML attribute of the <canvas> element interpreted in CSS pixels. When the attribute is not specified, or if it is set to an invalid value, like a negative, the default value of 300 is used.

methods.name: captureStream
methods.overview: Returns a CanvasCaptureMediaStream that is a real-time video capture of the surface of the canvas.

methods.name: getContext
methods.overview: Returns a drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context ID is not supported. A drawing context lets you draw on the canvas. Calling getContext with "2d" returns a CanvasRenderingContext2D object, whereas calling it with "webgl" (or "experimental-webgl") returns a WebGLRenderingContext object. This context is only available on browsers that implement WebGL.

methods.name: toBlob
methods.overview: Creates a Blob object representing the image contained in the canvas; this file may be cached on the disk or stored in memory at the discretion of the user agent.

methods.name: toDataURL
methods.overview: Returns a data-URL containing a representation of the image in the format specified by the type parameter (defaults to png). The returned image is in a resolution of 96dpi.

methods.name: transferControlToOffscreen
methods.overview: Transfers control to an OffscreenCanvas object, either on the main thread or on a worker.

name: HTMLCollection
overview: ["The HTMLCollection interface represents a generic collection (array-like object similar to arguments) of elements (in document order) and offers methods and properties for selecting from the list."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: Returns the number of items in the collection.

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Returns the specific node at the given zero-based index into the list. Returns null if the index is out of range.

methods.name: namedItem
methods.overview: Returns the specific node whose ID or, as a fallback, name matches the string specified by name. Matching by name is only done as a last resort, only in HTML, and only if the referenced element supports the name attribute. Returns null if no node exists by the given name.

name: HTMLDListElement
overview:
["The HTMLDListElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating definition list ( element represents a description list. The element encloses a list of groups of terms (specified using the
element) and descriptions (provided by
elements). Common uses for this element are to implement a glossary or to display metadata (a list of key-value pairs).\"><dl>) elements."]

properties.name: compact
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating that spacing between list items should be reduced.

name: HTMLDataElement
overview: ["The HTMLDataElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating element links a given content with a machine-readable translation. If the content is time- or date-related, the element must be used.\"><data> elements."]

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the value HTML attribute, containing a machine-readable form of the element's value.

name: HTMLDataListElement
overview: ["The HTMLDataListElement interface provides special properties (beyond the HTMLElement object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) to manipulate element contains a set of elements and their content."]

properties.name: options
properties.overview: Is a HTMLCollection representing a collection of the contained option elements.

name: HTMLDetailsElement
overview: ["The HTMLDetailsElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating ) creates a disclosure widget in which information is visible only when the widget is toggled into an "open" state.\"><details> elements."]

properties.name: open
properties.overview: Is a boolean reflecting the open HTML attribute, indicating whether or not the element’s contents (not counting the <summary>) is to be shown to the user.

name: HTMLDialogElement
overview:
["This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production."]

properties.name: open
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the open HTML attribute, indicating whether the dialog is available for interaction.

properties.name: returnValue
properties.overview: A DOMString that sets or returns the return value for the dialog.

methods.name: close
methods.overview: Closes the dialog. An optional DOMString may be passed as an argument, updating the returnValue of the the dialog.

methods.name: show
methods.overview: Displays the dialog modelessly, i.e. still allowing interaction with content outside of the dialog.

methods.name: showModal
methods.overview: Displays the dialog as a modal, over the top of any other dialogs that might be present. Interaction outside the dialog is blocked.

name: HTMLDivElement
overview: ["The HTMLDivElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating ) is the generic container for flow content. It has no effect on the content or layout until styled using CSS.\"><div> elements."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing an enumerated property indicating alignment of the element's contents with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "justify", and "center".

name: HTMLDocument
overview: ["The HTMLDocument interface, which may be accessed through the Window.HTMLDocument property, extends the Window.HTMLDocument property to include methods and properties that are specific to HTML documents."]

name: HTMLElement
overview: ["The HTMLElement interface represents any HTML element. Some elements directly implement this interface, while others implement it via an interface that inherits it."]

properties.name: accessKey
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the access key assigned to the element.

properties.name: dir
properties.overview: Is a DOMString, reflecting the dir global attribute, representing the directionality of the element. Possible values are "ltr", "rtl", and "auto".

properties.name: draggable
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating if the element can be dragged.

properties.name: hidden
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating if the element is hidden or not.

properties.name: inert
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether the user agent must act as though the given node is absent for the purposes of user interaction events, in-page text searches ("find in page"), and text selection.

properties.name: innerText
properties.overview: Represents the "rendered" text content of a node and its descendants. As a getter, it approximates the text the user would get if they highlighted the contents of the element with the cursor and then copied it to the clipboard.

properties.name: lang
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the language of an element's attributes, text, and element contents.

properties.name: offsetHeight
properties.overview: Returns a double containing the height of an element, relative to the layout.

properties.name: offsetLeft
properties.overview: Returns a double, the distance from this element's left border to its offsetParent's left border.

properties.name: offsetParent
properties.overview: Returns a Element that is the element from which all offset calculations are currently computed.

properties.name: offsetTop
properties.overview: Returns a double, the distance from this element's top border to its offsetParent's top border.

properties.name: offsetWidth
properties.overview: Returns a double containing the width of an element, relative to the layout.

properties.name: spellcheck
properties.overview: Is a Boolean that controls spell-checking. It is present on all HTML elements, though it doesn't have an effect on all of them.

properties.name: title
properties.overview: Is a DOMString containing the text that appears in a popup box when mouse is over the element.

properties.name: translate
properties.overview: Is a Boolean representing the translation.

methods.name: click
methods.overview: Sends a mouse click event to the element.

name: HTMLEmbedElement
