overview: ["The HTMLEmbedElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating element embeds external content at the specified point in the document. This content is provided by an external application or other source of interactive content such as a browser plug-in.\"><embed> elements."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing an enumerated property indicating alignment of the element's contents with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "center", and "justify".

properties.name: height
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the height HTML attribute, containing the displayed height of the resource.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the name of the embedded object.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the address of the resource.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the type HTML attribute, containing the type of the resource.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the width HTML attribute, containing the displayed width of the resource.

name: HTMLFieldSetElement
overview: ["The HTMLFieldSetElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element is used to group several controls as well as labels ( elements."]

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the disabled HTML attribute, indicating whether the user can interact with the control.

properties.name: elements
properties.overview: The elements belonging to this field set. The type of this property depends on the version of the spec that is implemented by the browser.

properties.name: form
properties.overview:
An HTMLFormControlsCollection or HTMLCollection referencing the containing form element, if this element is in a form.
If the field set is not a descendant of a form element, then the attribute can be the ID of any form element in the same document it is related to, or the null value if none matches.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the name HTML attribute, containing the name of the field set, used for submitting the form.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: The DOMString "fieldset".

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: A DOMString representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the element does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the element is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: A ValidityState representing the validity states that this element is in.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview: A Boolean false, because <fieldset> objects are never candidates for constraint validation.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Always returns true because <fieldset> objects are never candidates for constraint validation.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: Always returns true because <fieldset> objects are never candidates for constraint validation.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Sets a custom validity message for the field set. If this message is not the empty string, then the field set is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.

name: HTMLFontElement
overview:
["Obsolete
This feature is obsolete. Although it may still work in some browsers, its use is discouraged since it could be removed at any time. Try to avoid using it."]

properties.name: color
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the color HTML attribute, containing either a named color or a color specified in the hexadecimal #RRGGBB format.

properties.name: face
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the face HTML attribute, containing a comma-separated list of one or more font names.

properties.name: size
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the size HTML attribute, containing either a font size number ranging from 1 to 7 or a relative size to the size attribute of the <basefont> element, for example -2 or +1.

name: HTMLFormControlsCollection
overview: ["The HTMLFormControlsCollection interface represents a collection of HTML form control elements. It represents the lists returned by the element in the DOM; it allows access to and in some cases modification of aspects of the form, as well as access to its component elements.\">HTMLFormElement interface's element.\">elements property and the elements.\">HTMLFieldSetElement interface's elements property.","This interface replaces one method from HTMLCollection, on which it is based."]

methods.name: namedItem
methods.overview: Returns the RadioNodeList or the Element in the collection whose name or id matches the specified name, or null if no nodes match. Note that this version of namedItem() hide the one inherited from HTMLCollection. Like that one, in JavaScript, using the array bracket syntax with a String, like collection["value"] is equivalent to collection.namedItem("value").

name: HTMLFormElement
overview: ["The HTMLFormElement interface represents a element represents a document section containing interactive controls for submitting information.\"><form> element in the DOM; it allows access to and in some cases modification of aspects of the form, as well as access to its component elements."]

properties.name: acceptCharset
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's accept-charset HTML attribute, representing the character encoding that the server accepts.

properties.name: action
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's action HTML attribute, containing the URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the form.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's autocomplete HTML attribute, indicating whether the controls in this form can have their values automatically populated by the browser.

properties.name: elements
properties.overview: A HTMLFormControlsCollection holding all form controls belonging to this form element.

properties.name: encoding
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's enctype HTML attribute, indicating the type of content that is used to transmit the form to the server. Only specified values can be set. The two properties are synonyms.

properties.name: enctype
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's enctype HTML attribute, indicating the type of content that is used to transmit the form to the server. Only specified values can be set. The two properties are synonyms.

properties.name: length
properties.overview: A long reflecting  the number of controls in the form.

properties.name: method
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's method HTML attribute, indicating the HTTP method used to submit the form. Only specified values can be set.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's name HTML attribute, containing the name of the form.

properties.name: noValidate
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the value of the form's  novalidate HTML attribute, indicating whether the form should not be validated.

properties.name: target
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form's target HTML attribute, indicating where to display the results received from submitting the form.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Returns true if the element's child controls are subject to constraint validation and satisfy those contraints; returns false if some controls do not satisfy their constraints. Fires an event named invalid at any control that does not satisfy its constraints; such controls are considered invalid if the event is not canceled. It is up to the programmer to decide how to respond to false.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: Returns true if the element's child controls satisfy their validation constraints. When false is returned, cancelable invalid events are fired for each invalid child and validation problems are reported to the user.

methods.name: requestSubmit
methods.overview: Requests that the form be submitted using the specified submit button and its corresponding configuration.

methods.name: reset
methods.overview: Resets the form to its initial state.

methods.name: submit
methods.overview: Submits the form to the server.

name: HTMLFrameSetElement
overview:
["Obsolete
This feature is obsolete. Although it may still work in some browsers, its use is discouraged since it could be removed at any time. Try to avoid using it."]

properties.name: cols
properties.overview: Is a DOMString structured as a comma-seperated list specifing the width of each column inside a frameset.

properties.name: rows
properties.overview: Is a DOMString structured as a comma-seperated list specifing the height of each column inside a frameset.

name: HTMLHRElement
overview: ["The HTMLHRElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating element represents a thematic break between paragraph-level elements: for example, a change of scene in a story, or a shift of topic within a section.\"><hr> elements."]

name: HTMLHeadElement
overview: ["The HTMLHeadElement interface contains the descriptive information, or metadata, for a document. This object inherits all of the properties and methods described in the HTMLElement interface."]

name: HTMLHeadingElement
overview: ["The HTMLHeadingElement interface represents the different heading elements. It inherits methods and properties from the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing an enumerated attribute indicating alignment of the heading with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "justify", and "center".

name: HTMLHtmlElement
overview: ["The HTMLHtmlElement interface serves as the root node for a given HTML document. This object inherits the properties and methods described in the HTMLElement interface.","You can retrieve the HTMLHtmlElement object for a given document by reading the value of the element for HTML documents).\">document.documentElement property."]

properties.name: version
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the version of the HTML Document Type Definition (DTD) that governs this document. This property should not be used any more as it is non-conforming. Simply omit it.

name: HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils
overview:
["This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production."]

properties.name: hash
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing a '#' followed by the fragment identifier of the URL.

properties.name: host
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the host, that is the hostname, and then, if the port of the URL is not empty (which can happen because it was not specified or because it was specified to be the default port of the URL's scheme), a ':', and the port of the URL.

properties.name: hostname
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the domain of the URL.

properties.name: href
properties.overview: This a stringifier property that returns a USVString containing the whole URL, and allows the href to be updated.

properties.name: origin
properties.overview: This returns a USVString containing the origin of the URL (that is its scheme, its domain and its port).

properties.name: password
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the password specified before the domain name.

properties.name: pathname
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing an initial '/' followed by the path of the URL.

properties.name: port
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the port number of the URL.

properties.name: protocol
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the protocol scheme of the URL, including the final ':'.

properties.name: search
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing a '?' followed by the parameters of the URL.

properties.name: username
properties.overview: This is a USVString containing the username specified before the domain name.

methods.name: toString
methods.overview: This returns a USVString containing the whole URL. It is a synonym for HTMLHyperlinkElementUtils.href, though it can't be used to modify the value.

name: HTMLIFrameElement
overview: ["The HTMLIFrameElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of inline frame elements."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that specifies the alignment of the frame with respect to the surrounding context.

properties.name: allow
properties.overview: Is a list of origins the the frame is allowed to display content from. This attribute also accepts the values self and src which represent the origin in the iframe's src attribute. The default value is src.

properties.name: allowFullscreen
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether the inline frame is willing to be placed into full screen mode. See Using full-screen mode for details.

properties.name: allowPaymentRequest
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating whether the Payment Request API may be invoked inside a cross-origin iframe.

properties.name: contentDocument
properties.overview: Returns a Document, the active document in the inline frame's nested browsing context.

properties.name: contentWindow
properties.overview: Returns a WindowProxy, the window proxy for the nested browsing context.

properties.name: csp
properties.overview: Specifies the Content Security Policy that an embedded document must agree to enforce upon itself.

properties.name: featurePolicy
properties.overview: Returns the FeaturePolicy interface which provides a simple API for introspecting the feature policies applied to a specific document.

properties.name: frameBorder
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that indicates whether to create borders between frames.

properties.name: height
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the height HTML attribute, indicating the height of the frame.

properties.name: longDesc
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that contains the URI of a long description of the frame.

properties.name: marginHeight
properties.overview: Is a DOMString being the height of the frame margin.

properties.name: marginWidth
properties.overview: Is a DOMString being the width of the frame margin.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the name HTML attribute, containing a name by which to refer to the frame.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use when fetching the linked resource.

properties.name: sandbox
properties.overview: Is a DOMSettableTokenList that reflects the sandbox HTML attribute, indicating extra restrictions on the behavior of the nested content.

properties.name: scrolling
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that indicates whether the browser should provide scrollbars for the frame.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the address of the content to be embedded. Note that programatically removing an <iframe>'s src attribute (e.g. via Element.removeAttribute()) causes about:blank to be loaded in the frame in Firefox (from version 65), Chromium-based browsers, and Safari/iOS.

properties.name: srcdoc
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that represents the content to display in the frame.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the width HTML attribute, indicating the width of the frame.

name: HTMLImageElement
overview: ["The HTMLImageElement interface represents an HTML element embeds an image into the document.\"><img> element, providing the properties and methods used to manipulate image elements."]

properties.name: alt
properties.overview: A DOMString that reflects the alt HTML attribute, thus indicating the alternate fallback content to be displayed if the image has not been loaded.

properties.name: complete
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean that is true if the browser has finished fetching the image, whether successful or not. That means this value is also true if the image has no src value indicating an image to load.

properties.name: crossOrigin
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the CORS setting for this image element. See CORS settings attributes for further details. This may be null if CORS is not used.

properties.name: currentSrc
properties.overview: Returns a USVString representing the URL from which the currently displayed image was loaded. This may change as the image is adjusted due to changing conditions, as directed by any media queries which are in place.

properties.name: decoding
properties.overview: An optional DOMString representing a hint given to the browser on how it should decode the image. If this value is provided, it must be one of the possible permitted values: sync to decode the image synchronously, async to decode it asynchronously, or auto to indicate no preference (which is the default). Read the decoding page for details on the implications of this property's values.

properties.name: height
properties.overview: An integer value that reflects the height HTML attribute, indicating the rendered height of the image in CSS pixels.

properties.name: isMap
properties.overview: A Boolean that reflects the ismap HTML attribute, indicating that the image is part of a server-side image map. This is different from a client-side image map, specified using an <img> element and a corresponding <map> which contains <area> elements indicating the clickable areas in the image. The image must be contained within an <a> element; see the ismap page for details.

properties.name: naturalHeight
properties.overview: Returns an integer value representing the intrinsic height of the image in CSS pixels, if it is available; else, it shows 0. This is the height the image would be if it were rendered at its natural full size.

properties.name: naturalWidth
properties.overview: An integer value representing the intrinsic width of the image in CSS pixels, if it is available; otherwise, it will show 0. This is the width the image would be if it were rendered at its natural full size.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: A DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute, which tells the user agent how to decide which referrer to use in order to fetch the image. Read this article for details on the possible values of this string.

properties.name: sizes
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the sizes HTML attribute. This string specifies a list of comma-separated conditional sizes for the image; that is, for a given viewport size, a particular image size is to be used. Read the documentation on the sizes page for details on the format of this string.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: A USVString that reflects the src HTML attribute, which contains the full URL of the image including base URI. You can load a different image into the element by changing the URL in the src attribute.

properties.name: srcset
properties.overview: A USVString reflecting the srcset HTML attribute. This specifies a list of candidate images, separated by commas (',', U+002C COMMA). Each candidate image is a URL followed by a space, followed by a specially-formatted string indicating the size of the image. The size may be specified either the width or a size multiple. Read the srcset page for specifics on the format of the size substring.

properties.name: useMap
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the usemap HTML attribute, containing the page-local URL of the <map> element describing the image map to use. The page-local URL is a pound (hash) symbol (#) followed by the ID of the <map> element, such as #my-map-element. The <map> in turn contains <area> elements indicating the clickable areas in the image.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: An integer value that reflects the width HTML attribute, indicating the rendered width of the image in CSS pixels.

properties.name: x
properties.overview: An integer indicating the horizontal offset of the left border edge of the image's CSS layout box relative to the origin of the <html> element's containing block.

properties.name: y
properties.overview: The integer vertical offset of the top border edge of the image's CSS layout box relative to the origin of the <html> element's containing block.

methods.name: decode
methods.overview: Returns a Promise that resolves when the image is decoded and it's safe to append the image to the DOM. This prevents rendering of the next frame from having to pause to decode the image, as would happen if an undecoded image were added to the DOM.

name: HTMLInputElement
overview: ["The HTMLInputElement interface provides special properties and methods for manipulating the options, layout, and presentation of element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms in order to accept data from the user; a wide variety of types of input data and control widgets are available, depending on the device and user agent. \"><input> elements."]

properties.name: accept
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's accept attribute, containing comma-separated list of file types accepted by the server when type is file.

properties.name: alt
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's alt attribute, containing alternative text to use when type is image.

properties.name: autocomplete
properties.overview:
string: Returns / Sets the element's autocomplete attribute, indicating whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

Ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type (button, submit, reset, image).

Possible values are:
on: the browser can autocomplete the value using previously stored value
off: the user must explicity enter a value

properties.name: autofocus
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the element's autofocus attribute, which specifies that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute. It cannot be applied if the type attribute is set to hidden (that is, you cannot automatically set focus to a hidden control).

properties.name: checked
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the current state of the element when type is checkbox or radio.

properties.name: defaultChecked
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the default state of a radio button or checkbox as originally specified in HTML that created this object.

properties.name: defaultValue
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the default value as originally specified in the HTML that created this object.

properties.name: dirName
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the directionality of the element.

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the element's disabled attribute, indicating that the control is not available for interaction. The input values will not be submitted with the form. See also readonly

properties.name: files
properties.overview: FileList array: Returns the list of selected files.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: HTMLFormElement object: Returns a reference to the parent <form> element.

properties.name: formAction
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's formaction attribute, containing the URI of a program that processes information submitted by the element. This overrides the action attribute of the parent form.

properties.name: formEnctype
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's formenctype attribute, containing the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. This overrides the enctype attribute of the parent form.

properties.name: formMethod
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's formmethod attribute, containing the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. This overrides the method attribute of the parent form.

properties.name: formNoValidate
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the element's formnovalidate attribute, indicating that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. This overrides the novalidate attribute of the parent form.

properties.name: formTarget
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's formtarget attribute, containing a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. This overrides the target attribute of the parent form.

properties.name: height
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's height attribute, which defines the height of the image displayed for the button, if the value of type is image.

properties.name: indeterminate
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns whether the checkbox or radio button is in indeterminate state. For checkboxes, the effect is that the appearance of the checkbox is obscured/greyed in some way as to indicate its state is indeterminate (not checked but not unchecked). Does not affect the value of the checked attribute, and clicking the checkbox will set the value to false.

properties.name: inputMode
properties.overview: Provides a hint to browsers as to the type of virtual keyboard configuration to use when editing this element or its contents.

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: NodeList array: Returns a list of <label> elements that are labels for this element.

properties.name: list
properties.overview: HTMLElement object: Returns the element pointed by the list attribute. The property may be null if no HTML element found in the same tree.

properties.name: max
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's max attribute, containing the maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.overview: long: Returns / Sets the element's maxlength attribute, containing the maximum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the value can have. (If you set this to a negative number, an exception will be thrown.)

properties.name: min
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's min attribute, containing the minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

properties.name: minLength
properties.overview: long: Returns / Sets the element's minlength attribute, containing the minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the value can have. (If you set this to a negative number, an exception will be thrown.)

properties.name: multiple
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the element's multiple attribute, indicating whether more than one value is possible (e.g., multiple files).

properties.name: name
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's name attribute, containing a name that identifies the element when submitting the form.

properties.name: pattern
properties.overview:
string: Returns / Sets the element's pattern attribute, containing a regular expression that the control's value is checked against. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user.

This attribute only applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.overview:
string: Returns / Sets the element's placeholder attribute, containing a hint to the user of what can be entered in the control. The placeholder text must not contain carriage returns or line-feeds.

This attribute only applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email.

properties.name: readOnly
properties.overview:
boolean: Returns / Sets the element's readonly attribute, indicating that the user cannot modify the value of the control.
HTML5.

This attribute is ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, range, color, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

properties.name: required
properties.overview: Boolean: Returns / Sets the element's required attribute, indicating that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

properties.name: selectionDirection
properties.overview:
string: Returns / Sets the direction in which selection occurred.

Possible values are:
forward if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale
backward for the opposite direction
none if the direction is unknown

properties.name: selectionEnd
properties.overview: unsigned long: Returns / Sets the end index of the selected text. When there's no selection, this returns the offset of the character immediately following the current text input cursor position.

properties.name: selectionStart
properties.overview: unsigned long: Returns / Sets the beginning index of the selected text. When nothing is selected, this returns the position of the text input cursor (caret) inside of the <input> element.

properties.name: size
properties.overview:
unsigned long: Returns / Sets the element's size attribute, which contains the visual size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of type is text or password, in which case, it is an integer number of characters.

This attribute only applies when type is set to text, search, tel, url, email, or password.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's src attribute, which specifies a URI for the location of an image to display on the graphical submit button, if the value of type is image; otherwise it is ignored.

properties.name: step
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's step attribute, which works with min and max to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the element's type attribute, indicating the type of control to display. See type attribute of <input> for possible values.

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: string: Returns a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willvalidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints. This value can be set by the setCustomValidity method.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: ValidityState object: Returns the element's current validity state.

properties.name: value
properties.overview:
string: Returns / Sets the current value of the control.

Note: If the user enters a value different from the value expected, this may return an empty string.

properties.name: valueAsDate
properties.overview: Date object: Returns / Sets the value of the element, interpreted as a date, or null if conversion is not possible.

properties.name: valueAsNumber
properties.overview:
double: Returns the value of the element, interpreted as one of the following, in order:
  • A time value
  • A number
  • NaN if conversion is impossible

properties.name: width
properties.overview: string: Returns / Sets the document's width attribute, which defines the width of the image displayed for the button, if the value of type is image.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview:
Boolean: Returns whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation.

It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation, including: its type is hidden, reset, or button; it has a datalist ancestor; or its disabled property is true.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Returns a Boolean that is false if the element is a candidate for constraint validation, and it does not satisfy its constraints. In this case, it also fires an invalid event at the element. It returns true if the element is not a candidate for constraint validation, or if it satisfies its constraints. Inherited from HTMLObjectElement

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: Runs the checkValidity() method, and if it returns false (for an invalid input or no pattern pattern attribute provided), then it reports to the user that the input is invalid in the same manner as if you submitted a form. Inherited from HTMLFormElement

methods.name: select
methods.overview: Selects all the text in the input element, and focuses it so the user can subsequently replace all of its content.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate. Inherited from HTMLObjectElement

methods.name: setRangeText
methods.overview: Replaces a range of text in the input element with new text.

methods.name: setSelectionRange
methods.overview: Selects a range of text in the input element (but does not focus it).

methods.name: stepDown
methods.overview: Decrements the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified.

methods.name: stepUp
methods.overview: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified.

name: HTMLLIElement
overview: ["The HTMLLIElement interface exposes specific properties and methods (beyond those defined by regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating list elements."]

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the type of the bullets, "disc", "square" or "circle". As the standard way of defining the list type is via the CSS list-style-type property, use the CSSOM methods to set it via a script.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Is a long indicating the ordinal position of the list element inside a given <ol>. It reflects the value attribute of the HTML <li> element, and can be smaller than 0. If the <li> element is not a child of an <ol> element, the property has no meaning.

name: HTMLLabelElement
overview: ["The HTMLLabelElement interface gives access to properties specific to element represents a caption for an item in a user interface.\"><label> elements. It inherits methods and properties from the base HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: control
properties.overview: Is a HTMLElement representing the control with which the label is associated.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: Is a HTMLFormElement object representing the form with which the labeled control is associated, or null if there is no associated control, or if that control isn't associated with a form. In other words, this is just a shortcut for HTMLLabelElement.control.form.

properties.name: htmlFor
properties.overview: Is a string containing the ID of the labeled control. This reflects the for attribute.

name: HTMLLegendElement
overview:
["The HTMLLegendElement is an interface allowing to access properties of the element represents a caption for the content of its parent
.\"><legend> elements. It inherits properties and methods from the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Alignment relative to the form set

properties.name: form
properties.overview: The form that this legend belongs to. If the legend has a fieldset element as its parent, then this attribute returns the same value as the form attribute on the parent fieldset element. Otherwise, it returns null.

name: HTMLLinkElement
overview: ["The HTMLLinkElement interface represents reference information for external resources and the relationship of those resources to a document and vice-versa (corresponds to <link> element; not to be confused with <a>, which is represented by HTMLAnchorElement). This object inherits all of the properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: as
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the type of content being loaded by the HTML link.

properties.name: crossOrigin
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that corresponds to the CORS setting for this link element. See CORS settings attributes for details.

properties.name: href
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the URI for the target resource.

properties.name: hreflang
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the language code for the linked resource.

properties.name: media
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing a list of one or more media formats to which the resource applies.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use.

properties.name: rel
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the forward relationship of the linked resource from the document to the resource.

properties.name: relList
properties.overview: Is a DOMTokenList that reflects the rel HTML attribute, as a list of tokens.

properties.name: sizes
properties.overview: Is a DOMSettableTokenList that reflects the sizes HTML attribute, as a list of tokens.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the MIME type of the linked resource.

name: HTMLMapElement
overview: ["The HTMLMapElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular object HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of map elements."]

properties.name: areas
properties.overview: Is a live HTMLCollection representing the <area> elements associated to this <map>.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the <map> element for referencing it other context. If the id attribute is set, this must have the same value; and it cannot be null or empty.

name: HTMLMarqueeElement
overview:
["Draft
\n This page is not complete."]

properties.name: behavior
properties.overview: Sets how the text is scrolled within the marquee. Possible values are scroll, slide and alternate. If no value is specified, the default value is scroll.

properties.name: bgColor
properties.overview: Sets the background color through color name or hexadecimal value.

properties.name: direction
properties.overview: Sets the direction of the scrolling within the marquee. Possible values are left, right, up and down. If no value is specified, the default value is left.

properties.name: height
properties.overview: Sets the height in pixels or percentage value.

properties.name: hspace
properties.overview: Sets the horizontal margin.

properties.name: scrollAmount
properties.overview: Sets the amount of scrolling at each interval in pixels. The default value is 6.

properties.name: scrollDelay
properties.overview: Sets the interval between each scroll movement in milliseconds. The default value is 85. Note that any value smaller than 60 is ignored and the value 60 is used instead, unless trueSpeed is true.

properties.name: trueSpeed
properties.overview: By default, scrollDelay values lower than 60 are ignored. If trueSpeed is true, then those values are not ignored.

properties.name: vspace
properties.overview: Sets the vertical margin.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Sets the width in pixels or percentage value.

name: HTMLMediaElement
overview: ["The HTMLMediaElement interface adds to HTMLElement the properties and methods needed to support basic media-related capabilities that are common to audio and video. The HTMLVideoElement and elements, as well as methods to manipulate them.\">HTMLAudioElement elements both inherit this interface."]

properties.name: audioTracks
properties.overview: A AudioTrackList that lists the AudioTrack objects contained in the element.

properties.name: autoplay
properties.overview:
A Boolean that reflects the autoplay HTML attribute, indicating whether playback should automatically begin as soon as enough media is available to do so without interruption.

Note: Automatically playing audio when the user doesn't expect or desire it is a poor user experience and should be avoided in most cases, though there are exceptions. See the Autoplay guide for media and Web Audio APIs for more information. Keep in mind that browsers may ignore autoplay requests, so you should ensure that your code isn't dependent on autoplay working.

properties.name: buffered
properties.overview: Returns a TimeRanges object that indicates the ranges of the media source that the browser has buffered (if any) at the moment the buffered property is accessed.

properties.name: controls
properties.overview: Is a Boolean that reflects the controls HTML attribute, indicating whether user interface items for controlling the resource should be displayed.

properties.name: controlsList
properties.overview: Returns a DOMTokenList that helps the user agent select what controls to show on the media element whenever the user agent shows its own set of controls. The DOMTokenList takes one or more of three possible values: nodownload, nofullscreen, and noremoteplayback.

properties.name: crossOrigin
properties.overview: A DOMString indicating the CORS setting for this media element.

properties.name: currentSrc
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString with the absolute URL of the chosen media resource.

properties.name: currentTime
properties.overview: A double-precision floating-point value indicating the current playback time in seconds; if the media has not started to play and has not been seeked, this value is the media's initial playback time. Setting this value seeks the media to the new time. The time is specified relative to the media's timeline.

properties.name: defaultMuted
properties.overview: A Boolean that reflects the muted HTML attribute, which indicates whether the media element's audio output should be muted by default.

properties.name: defaultPlaybackRate
properties.overview: A double indicating the default playback rate for the media.

properties.name: disableRemotePlayback
properties.overview: A Boolean that sets or returns the remote playback state, indicating whether the media element is allowed to have a remote playback UI.

properties.name: duration
properties.overview: A read-only double-precision floating-point value indicating the total duration of the media in seconds. If no media data is available, the returned value is NaN. If the media is of indefinite length (such as streamed live media, a WebRTC call's media, or similar), the value is +Infinity.

properties.name: ended
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the media element has finished playing.

properties.name: error
properties.overview: Returns a MediaError object for the most recent error, or null if there has not been an error.

properties.name: loop
properties.overview: A Boolean that reflects the loop HTML attribute, which indicates whether the media element should start over when it reaches the end.

properties.name: mediaKeys
properties.overview: Returns a MediaKeys object or null. MediaKeys is a set of keys that an associated HTMLMediaElement can use for decryption of media data during playback.

properties.name: muted
properties.overview: Is a Boolean that determines whether audio is muted. true if the audio is muted and false otherwise.

properties.name: networkState
properties.overview: Returns a unsigned short (enumeration) indicating the current state of fetching the media over the network.

properties.name: onencrypted
properties.overview: Sets the EventHandler called when the media is encrypted.

properties.name: onwaitingforkey
properties.overview: Sets the EventHandler called when playback is blocked while waiting for an encryption key.

properties.name: paused
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the media element is paused.

properties.name: playbackRate
properties.overview: Is a double that indicates the rate at which the media is being played back.

properties.name: played
properties.overview: Returns a TimeRanges object that contains the ranges of the media source that the browser has played, if any.

properties.name: preload
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the preload HTML attribute, indicating what data should be preloaded, if any. Possible values are: none, metadata, auto.

properties.name: readyState
properties.overview: Returns a unsigned short (enumeration) indicating the readiness state of the media.

properties.name: seekable
properties.overview: Returns a TimeRanges object that contains the time ranges that the user is able to seek to, if any.

properties.name: seeking
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the media is in the process of seeking to a new position.

properties.name: sinkId
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString that is the unique ID of the audio device delivering output, or an empty string if it is using the user agent default. This ID should be one of the MediaDeviceInfo.deviceid values returned from MediaDevices.enumerateDevices(), id-multimedia, or id-communications.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the src HTML attribute, which contains the URL of a media resource to use.

properties.name: textTracks
properties.overview: Returns the list of TextTrack objects contained in the element.

properties.name: videoTracks
properties.overview: Returns the list of VideoTrack objects contained in the element.

properties.name: volume
properties.overview: Is a double indicating the audio volume, from 0.0 (silent) to 1.0 (loudest).

methods.name: addTextTrack
methods.overview: Adds a text track (such as a track for subtitles) to a media element.

methods.name: canPlayType
methods.overview: Given a string specifying a MIME media type (potentially with the codecs parameter included), canPlayType() returns the string probably if the media should be playable, maybe if there's not enough information to determine whether the media will play or not, or an empty string if the media cannot be played.

methods.name: captureStream
methods.overview: Returns MediaStream, captures a stream of the media content.

methods.name: load
methods.overview: Resets the media to the beginning and selects the best available source from the sources provided using the src attribute or the <source> element.

methods.name: pause
methods.overview: Pauses the media playback.

methods.name: play
methods.overview: Begins playback of the media.

methods.name: setMediaKeys
methods.overview: Returns Promise. Sets the MediaKeys keys to use when decrypting media during playback.

methods.name: setSinkId
methods.overview: Sets the ID of the audio device to use for output and returns a Promise. This only works when the application is authorized to use the specified device.

name: HTMLMenuElement
overview:
["Draft
\n This page is not complete."]

name: HTMLMetaElement
overview: ["The HTMLMetaElement interface contains descriptive metadata about a document. It inherits all of the properties and methods described in the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: content
properties.overview: Gets or sets the value of meta-data property.

properties.name: httpEquiv
properties.overview: Gets or sets the name of an HTTP response header to define for a document.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Gets or sets the name of a meta-data property to define for a document.

properties.name: scheme
properties.overview: Gets or sets the name of a scheme used to interpret the value of a meta-data property.

name: HTMLMeterElement
overview: ["The HTML element represents either a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value.\"><meter> elements expose the HTMLMeterElement interface, which provides special properties and methods (beyond the HTMLElement object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element represents either a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value.\"><meter> elements."]

properties.name: high
properties.overview: A double representing the value of the high boundary, reflecting the high attribute.

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: A NodeList of <label> elements that are associated with the element.

properties.name: low
properties.overview: A double representing the value of the low boundary, reflecting the lowattribute.

properties.name: max
properties.overview: A double representing the maximum value, reflecting the max attribute.

properties.name: min
properties.overview: A double representing the minimum value, reflecting the min attribute.

properties.name: optimum
properties.overview: A double representing the optimum, reflecting the optimum attribute.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: A double representing the currrent value, reflecting the value attribute.

name: HTMLModElement
overview: ["The HTMLModElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular methods and properties available through the HTMLElement interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating modification elements, that is element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document.\"><del> and element represents a range of text that has been added to a document.\"><ins>."]

properties.name: cite
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the cite HTML attribute, containing a URI of a resource explaining the change.

properties.name: dateTime
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the datetime HTML attribute, containing a date-and-time string representing a timestamp for the change.

name: HTMLOListElement
overview: ["The HTMLOListElement interface provides special properties (beyond those defined on the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating ordered list elements."]

properties.name: compact
properties.overview: Is a Boolean indicating that spacing between list items should be reduced. This property reflects the compact attribute only, it doesn't consider the line-height CSS property used for that behavior in modern pages.

properties.name: reversed
properties.overview: Is a Boolean value reflecting the reversed and defining if the numbering is descending, that is its value is true, or ascending (false).

properties.name: start
properties.overview: Is a long value reflecting the start and defining the value of the first number of the first element of the list.

properties.name: type
properties.overview:
Is a DOMString value reflecting the type and defining the kind of marker to be used to display. It can have the following values:
  • '1' meaning that decimal numbers are used: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, …
  • 'a' meaning that the lowercase latin alphabet is used:  a, b, c, d, e, …
  • 'A' meaning that the uppercase latin alphabet is used: A, B, C, D, E, …
  • 'i' meaning that the lowercase latin numerals are used: i, ii, iii, iv, v, …
  • 'I' meaning that the uppercase latin numerals are used: I, II, III, IV, V, …

name: HTMLObjectElement
overview: ["The HTMLObjectElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those on the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element represents an external resource, which can be treated as an image, a nested browsing context, or a resource to be handled by a plugin.\"><object> element, representing external resources."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing an enumerated property indicating alignment of the element's contents with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "justify", and "center".

properties.name: archive
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the archive HTML attribute, containing a list of archives for resources for this object.

properties.name: border
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the border HTML attribute, specifying the width of a border around the object.

properties.name: code
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the name of an applet class file, containing either the applet's subclass, or the path to get to the class, including the class file itself.

properties.name: codeBase
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the codebase HTML attribute, specifying the base path to use to resolve relative URIs.

properties.name: codeType
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the codetype HTML attribute, specifying the content type of the data.

properties.name: contentDocument
properties.overview: Returns a Document representing the active document of the object element's nested browsing context, if any; otherwise null.

properties.name: contentWindow
properties.overview: Returns a WindowProxy representing the window proxy of the object element's nested browsing context, if any; otherwise null.

properties.name: data
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString that reflects the data HTML attribute, specifying the address of a resource's data.

properties.name: declare
properties.overview: Is a Boolean that reflects the declare HTML attribute, indicating that this is a declaration, not an instantiation, of the object.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: Retuns a HTMLFormElement representing the object element's form owner, or null if there isn't one.

properties.name: height
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString that reflects the height HTML attribute, specifying the displayed height of the resource in CSS pixels.

properties.name: hspace
properties.overview: Is a long representing the horizontal space in pixels around the control.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString that reflects the name HTML attribute, specifying the name of the browsing context.

properties.name: standby
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the standby HTML attribute, specifying a message to display while the object loads.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the type HTML attribute, specifying the MIME type of the resource.

properties.name: useMap
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the usemap HTML attribute, specifying a <map> element to use.

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: Returns a ValidityState with the validity states that this element is in.

properties.name: vspace
properties.overview: Is a long representing the horizontal space in pixels around the control.

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Is a DOMString that reflects the width HTML attribute, specifying the displayed width of the resource in CSS pixels.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation. Always false for HTMLObjectElement objects.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Retuns a Boolean that always is true, because object objects are never candidates for constraint validation.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: Returns true if the element's value has no validity problems; otherwise, returns false, fires an invalid event at the element, and (if the event isn't canceled) reports the problem to the user.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.

name: HTMLOptGroupElement
overview: ["The HTMLOptGroupElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element creates a grouping of options within a

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: Is a boolean representing whether or not the whole list of children <option> is disabled (true) or not (false).

properties.name: label
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the label for the group.

name: HTMLOptionElement
overview: ["The HTMLOptionElement interface represents element is used to define an item contained in a

properties.name: defaultSelected
properties.overview: Contains the initial value of the selected HTML attribute, indicating whether the option is selected by default or not.

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: Reflects the value of the disabled HTML attribute, which indicates that the option is unavailable to be selected. An option can also be disabled if it is a child of an <optgroup> element that is disabled.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: If the option is a descendent of a <select> element, then this property has the same value as the form property of the corresponding HTMLSelectElement object; otherwise, it is null.

properties.name: index
properties.overview: The position of the option within the list of options it belongs to, in tree-order. If the option is not part of a list of options, like when it is part of the <datalist> element, the value is 0.

properties.name: label
properties.overview: Reflects the value of the label HTML attribute, which provides a label for the option. If this attribute isn't specifically set, reading it returns the element's text content.

properties.name: selected
properties.overview: Indicates whether the option is currently selected.

properties.name: text
properties.overview: Contains the text content of the element.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Reflects the value of the value HTML attribute, if it exists; otherwise reflects value of the Node.textContent property.

name: HTMLOptionsCollection
overview: ["This interface inherits the methods of its parent, HTMLCollection."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: As optionally allowed by the spec, this property isn't read-only. You can either remove options from the end by lowering the value, or add blank options at the end by raising the value. Mozilla allows this, while other implementations could potentially throw a DOMException.

methods.name: add
methods.overview: Inserts element before the node given by before.

methods.name: remove
methods.overview: Removes the item with index index from the collection.

name: HTMLOutputElement
overview: ["The HTMLOutputElement interface provides properties and methods (beyond those inherited from HTMLElement) for manipulating the layout and presentation of ) is a container element into which a site or app can inject the results of a calculation or the outcome of a user action.\"><output> elements."]

properties.name: defaultValue
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the default value of the element, initially the empty string.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: An HTMLFormElement indicating the form associated with the control, reflecting the form HTML attribute if it is defined.

properties.name: htmlFor
properties.overview: A DOMTokenList reflecting the for HTML attribute, containing a list of IDs of other elements in the same document that contribute to (or otherwise affect) the calculated value.

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: A NodeList of <label> elements associated with the element.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the name HTML attribute, containing the name for the control that is submitted with form data.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: The DOMString "output".

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: A DOMString representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: A ValidityState representing the validity states that this element is in.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: A DOMString representing the value of the contents of the elements. Behaves like the Node.textContent property.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview: A Boolean indicating whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Checks the validity of the element and returns a Boolean holding the check result.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: This method reports the problems with the constraints on the element, if any, to the user. If there are problems, fires an invalid event at the element, and returns false; if there are no problems, it returns true.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.

name: HTMLParagraphElement
overview: ["The HTMLParagraphElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface it inherits) for manipulating element represents a paragraph.\"><p> elements."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: A DOMString representing an enumerated property indicating alignment of the element's contents with respect to the surrounding context. The possible values are "left", "right", "justify", and "center".

name: HTMLParamElement
overview: ["The HTMLParamElement interface provides special properties (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface it inherits) for manipulating element defines parameters for an

properties.name: name
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the name of the parameter. It reflects the name attribute.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString containing the type of the parameter when valueType has the "ref" value. It reflects the type attribute.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the value associated to the parameter. It reflects the value attribute.

properties.name: valueType
properties.overview: Is a DOMString containing the type of the value. It reflects the valuetype attribute and has one of the values: "data", "ref", or "object".

name: HTMLPictureElement
overview:
["This is an experimental technology
Check the Browser compatibility table carefully before using this in production."]

name: HTMLPreElement
overview: ["The HTMLPreElement interface exposes specific properties and methods (beyond those of the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating a block of preformatted text ( element represents preformatted text which is to be presented exactly as written in the HTML file.\"><pre>)."]

properties.name: width
properties.overview: Is a long value reflecting the obsolete width attribute, containing a fixed-size length for the <pre> element.

name: HTMLProgressElement
overview: ["The HTMLProgressElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of element displays an indicator showing the completion progress of a task, typically displayed as a progress bar.\"><progress> elements."]

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: Returns NodeList containing the list of <label> elements that are labels for this element.

properties.name: max
properties.overview: Is a double value reflecting the content attribute of the same name, limited to numbers greater than zero. Its default value is 1.0.

properties.name: position
properties.overview: Returns a double value returning the result of dividing the current value (value) by the maximum value (max); if the progress bar is an indeterminate progress bar, it returns -1.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: Is a double value that reflects the current value; if the progress bar is an indeterminate progress bar, it returns 0.

name: HTMLQuoteElement
overview: ["The HTMLQuoteElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating quoting elements, like Element (or HTML Block Quotation Element) indicates that the enclosed text is an extended quotation. Usually, this is rendered visually by indentation (see Notes for how to change it). A URL for the source of the quotation may be given using the cite attribute, while a text representation of the source can be given using the element.\"><blockquote> and element indicates that the enclosed text is a short inline quotation. Most modern browsers implement this by surrounding the text in quotation marks. \"><q>, but not the ) is used to describe a reference to a cited creative work, and must include the title of that work.\"><cite> element."]

properties.name: cite
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the cite HTML attribute, containing a URL for the source of the quotation.

name: HTMLScriptElement
overview: ["HTML element is used to embed or reference executable code; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code.\"><script> elements expose the HTMLScriptElement interface, which provides special properties and methods for manipulating the behavior and execution of <script> elements (beyond the inherited HTMLElement interface).","JavaScript files should be served with the application/javascript MIME type, but browsers are lenient and block them only if the script is served with an image type (image/*), video type (video/*), audio type (audio/*), or text/csv. If the script is blocked, its element receives an error event; otherwise, it receives a load event."]

properties.name: async
properties.overview:
The async and defer attributes are boolean attributes that control how the script should be executed. The defer and async attributes must not be specified if the src attribute is absent.

There are three possible execution modes:

  1. If the async attribute is present, then the script will be executed asynchronously as soon as it downloads.
  2. If the async attribute is absent but the defer attribute is present, then the script is executed when the page has finished parsing.
  3. If neither attribute is present, then the script is fetched and executed immediately, blocking further parsing of the page.

The defer attribute may be specified with the async attribute, so legacy browsers that only support defer (and not async) fall back to the defer behavior instead of the default blocking behavior.

Note: The exact processing details for these attributes are complex, involving many different aspects of HTML, and therefore are scattered throughout the specification. These algorithms describe the core ideas, but they rely on the parsing rules for <script> start and end tags in HTML, in foreign content, and in XML; the rules for the document.write() method; the handling of scripting; and so on.

properties.name: charset
properties.overview: Represents the character encoding of an external script. It reflects the charset attribute.

properties.name: crossOrigin
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the CORS setting for the script element. For scripts from other origins, this controls if error information will be exposed.

properties.name: event
properties.overview: An old, quirky way of registering event handlers on elements in an HTML document.

properties.name: noModule
properties.overview: This Boolean property stops the script's execution in browsers that support ES2015 modules — used to run fallback scripts in older browsers that do not support JavaScript modules.

properties.name: referrerPolicy
properties.overview: A DOMString that reflects the referrerpolicy HTML attribute indicating which referrer to use when fetching the script, and fetches done by that script.

properties.name: src
properties.overview: Gets and sets the URL of an external script. It reflects the src attribute.

properties.name: text
properties.overview:
The IDL attribute text joins and returns the contents of all Text nodes inside the <script> element (ignoring other nodes like comments) in tree order. On setting, it acts the same way as the textContent IDL attribute.

Note: When inserted using the document.write() method, <script> elements execute (typically synchronously), but when inserted using innerHTML or outerHTML, they do not execute at all.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Represents the MIME type of the script. It reflects the type attribute.

name: HTMLSelectElement
overview: ["The HTMLSelectElement interface represents a element represents a control that provides a menu of options\"><select> HTML Element. These elements also share all of the properties and methods of other HTML elements via the HTMLElement interface."]

properties.name: autofocus
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the autofocus HTML attribute, which indicates whether the control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form-associated element in a document can have this attribute specified.

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the disabled HTML attribute, which indicates whether the control is disabled. If it is disabled, it does not accept clicks.

properties.name: form
properties.overview: An HTMLFormElement referencing the form that this element is associated with. If the element is not associated with of a <form> element, then it returns null.

properties.name: labels
properties.overview: A NodeList of <label> elements associated with the element.

properties.name: length
properties.overview: An unsigned long The number of <option> elements in this select element.

properties.name: multiple
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the multiple HTML attribute, which indicates whether multiple items can be selected.

properties.name: name
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the name HTML attribute, containing the name of this control used by servers and DOM search functions.

properties.name: options
properties.overview: An HTMLOptionsCollection representing the set of <option> elements contained by this element.

properties.name: required
properties.overview: A Boolean reflecting the required HTML attribute, which indicates whether the user is required to select a value before submitting the form.

properties.name: selectedIndex
properties.overview: A long reflecting the index of the first selected <option> element. The value -1 indicates no element is selected.

properties.name: selectedOptions
properties.overview: An HTMLCollection representing the set of <option> elements that are selected.

properties.name: size
properties.overview: A long reflecting the size HTML attribute, which contains the number of visible items in the control. The default is 1, unless multiple is true, in which case it is 4.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: A DOMString represeting the form control's type. When multiple is true, it returns "select-multiple"; otherwise, it returns "select-one".

properties.name: validationMessage
properties.overview: A DOMString representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This attribute is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

properties.name: validity
properties.overview: A ValidityState reflecting the validity state that this control is in.

properties.name: value
properties.overview: A DOMString reflecting the value of the form control. Returns the value property of the first selected option element if there is one, otherwise the empty string.

properties.name: willValidate
properties.overview: A Boolean that indicates whether the button is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation.

methods.name: add
methods.overview: Adds an element to the collection of option elements for this select element.

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.overview: Checks whether the element has any constraints and whether it satisfies them. If the element fails its constraints, the browser fires a cancelable invalid event at the element (and returns false).

methods.name: item
methods.overview: Gets an item from the options collection for this <select> element. You can also access an item by specifying the index in array-style brackets or parentheses, without calling this method explicitly.

methods.name: namedItem
methods.overview: Gets the item in the options collection with the specified name. The name string can match either the id or the name attribute of an option node. You can also access an item by specifying the name in array-style brackets or parentheses, without calling this method explicitly.

methods.name: remove
methods.overview: Removes the element at the specified index from the options collection for this select element.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.overview: This method reports the problems with the constraints on the element, if any, to the user. If there are problems, it fires a cancelable invalid event at the element, and returns false; if there are no problems, it returns true.

methods.name: setCustomValidity
methods.overview: Sets the custom validity message for the selection element to the specified message. Use the empty string to indicate that the element does not have a custom validity error.

name: HTMLSlotElement
overview: ["The HTMLSlotElement interface of the Shadow DOM API enables access to the name and assigned nodes of an HTML element—part of the Web Components technology suite—is a placeholder inside a web component that you can fill with your own markup, which lets you create separate DOM trees and present them together.\"><slot> element."]

properties.name: name
properties.overview: DOMString: Can be used to get and set the slot's name.

methods.name: assignedElements
methods.overview: Returns a sequence of the elements assigned to this slot (and no other nodes). If the flatten option is set to true, it also returns the assigned elements of any other slots that are descendants of this slot. If no assigned nodes are found, it returns the slot's fallback content.

methods.name: assignedNodes
methods.overview: Returns a sequence of the nodes assigned to this slot, and if the flatten option is set to true, the assigned nodes of any other slots that are descendants of this slot. If no assigned nodes are found, it returns the slot's fallback content.

name: HTMLSourceElement
overview: ["The HTMLSourceElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating element specifies multiple media resources for the , the elements."]

properties.name: media
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the media HTML attribute, containing the intended type of the media resource.

properties.name: sizes
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing image sizes between breakpoints

properties.name: src
properties.overview:
Is a DOMString reflecting the src HTML attribute, containing the URL for the media resource. The HTMLSourceElement.src property has a meaning only when the associated <source> element is nested in a media element that is a <video> or an <audio> element. It has no meaning and is ignored when it is nested in a <picture> element. 
Note: If the src property is updated (along with any siblings), the parent HTMLMediaElement's load method should be called when done, since <source> elements are not re-scanned automatically.

properties.name: srcset
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the srcset HTML attribute, containing a list of candidate images, separated by a comma (',', U+002C COMMA). A candidate image is a URL followed by a 'w' with the width of the images, or an 'x' followed by the pixel density.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString reflecting the type HTML attribute, containing the type of the media resource.

name: HTMLSpanElement
overview: ["The HTMLSpanElement interface represents a element is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang.\"><span> element and derives from the HTMLElement interface, but without implementing any additional properties or methods."]

name: HTMLStyleElement
overview: ["The HTMLStyleElement interface represents a element contains style information for a document, or part of a document.\"><style> element. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, HTMLElement, and from LinkStyle.","This interface doesn't allow to manipulate the CSS it contains (in most case). To manipulate CSS, see Using dynamic styling information for an overview of the objects used to manipulate specified CSS properties using the DOM."]

properties.name: media
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the intended destination medium for style information.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Is a DOMString representing the type of style being applied by this statement.

name: HTMLTableCaptionElement
overview: ["The HTMLTableCaptionElement interface special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating table caption elements."]

properties.name: align
properties.overview: Is a DOMString which represents an enumerated attribute indicating alignment of the caption with respect to the table.

name: HTMLTableCellElement
overview: ["The HTMLTableCellElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of table cells, either header or data cells, in an HTML document."]

properties.name: abbr
properties.overview: A DOMString which can be used on <th> elements (not on <td>), specifying an alternative label for the header cell.. This alternate label can be used in other contexts, such as when describing the headers that apply to a data cell. This is used to offer a shorter term for use by screen readers in particular, and is a valuable accessibility tool. Usually the value of abbr is an abbreviation or acronym, but can be any text that's appropriate contextually.

properties.name: cellIndex
