properties.overview: Returns a number representing the offset of the selection's anchor within the focusNode. If focusNode is a text node, this is the number of characters within focusNode preceding the focus. If focusNode is an element, this is the number of child nodes of the focusNode preceding the focus.

properties.name: isCollapsed
properties.overview: Returns a Boolean indicating whether the selection's start and end points are at the same position.

properties.name: rangeCount
properties.overview: Returns the number of ranges in the selection.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString describing the type of the current selection.

methods.name: addRange
methods.overview: A Range object that will be added to the selection.

methods.name: collapse
methods.overview: Collapses the current selection to a single point.

methods.name: collapseToEnd
methods.overview: Collapses the selection to the end of the last range in the selection.

methods.name: collapseToStart
methods.overview: Collapses the selection to the start of the first range in the selection.

methods.name: containsNode
methods.overview: Indicates if a certain node is part of the selection.

methods.name: deleteFromDocument
methods.overview: Deletes the selection's content from the document.

methods.name: empty
methods.overview: Removes all ranges from the selection. This is an alias for removeAllRanges() — See Selection.removeAllRanges() for more details.

methods.name: extend
methods.overview: Moves the focus of the selection to a specified point.

methods.name: getRangeAt
methods.overview: Returns a Range object representing one of the ranges currently selected.

methods.name: modify
methods.overview: Changes the current selection.

methods.name: removeAllRanges
methods.overview: Removes all ranges from the selection.

methods.name: removeRange
methods.overview: Removes a range from the selection.

methods.name: selectAllChildren
methods.overview: Adds all the children of the specified node to the selection.

methods.name: setBaseAndExtent
methods.overview: Sets the selection to be a range including all or parts of two specified DOM nodes, and any content located between them.

methods.name: setPosition
methods.overview: Collapses the current selection to a single point. This is an alias for collapse() — See Selection.collapse() for more details.

methods.name: toString
methods.overview: Returns a string currently being represented by the selection object, i.e. the currently selected text.

name: ShadowRoot
overview: ["The ShadowRoot interface of the Shadow DOM API is the root node of a DOM subtree that is rendered separately from a document's main DOM tree.","You can retrieve a reference to an element's shadow root using its Element.shadowRoot property, provided it was created using Element.attachShadow() with the mode option set to open."]

properties.name: delegatesFocus
properties.overview: Returns a boolean that indicates whether delegatesFocus was set when the shadow was attached (see Element.attachShadow()).

properties.name: host
properties.overview: Returns a reference to the DOM element the ShadowRoot is attached to.

properties.name: innerHTML
properties.overview: Sets or returns a reference to the DOM tree inside the ShadowRoot.

properties.name: mode
properties.overview: The mode of the ShadowRoot — either open or closed. This defines whether or not the shadow root's internal features are accessible from JavaScript.

name: Slotable
overview: ["The Slotable mixin defines features that allow nodes to become the contents of a element—part of the Web Components technology suite—is a placeholder inside a web component that you can fill with your own markup, which lets you create separate DOM trees and present them together.\"><slot> element — the following features are included in both Element and Text."]

properties.name: assignedSlot
properties.overview: Returns the <slot> the node is inserted in.

name: StyleSheet
overview: ["An object implementing the StyleSheet interface represents a single style sheet. CSS style sheets will further implement the more specialized CSSStyleSheet interface."]

properties.name: disabled
properties.overview: Is a Boolean representing whether the current stylesheet has been applied or not.

properties.name: href
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString representing the location of the stylesheet.

properties.name: media
properties.overview: Returns a MediaList representing the intended destination medium for style information.

properties.name: ownerNode
properties.overview: Returns a Node associating this style sheet with the current document.

properties.name: parentStyleSheet
properties.overview: Returns a StyleSheet including this one, if any; returns null if there aren't any.

properties.name: title
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString representing the advisory title of the current style sheet.

properties.name: type
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString representing the style sheet language for this style sheet.

name: Text
overview: ["The Text interface represents the textual content of Element or Attr. ","If an element has no markup within its content, it has a single child implementing Text that contains the element's text. However, if the element contains markup, it is parsed into information items and Text nodes that form its children.","New documents have a single Text node for each block of text. Over time, more Text nodes may be created as the document's content changes. The Node.normalize() method merges adjacent Text objects back into a single node for each block of text."]

properties.name: wholeText
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString containing the text of all Text nodes logically adjacent to this Node, concatenated in document order.

methods.name: splitText
methods.overview: Breaks the node into two nodes at a specified offset.

name: TextTrack
overview: ["The TextTrack interface—part of the API for handling WebVTT (text tracks on media presentations)—describes and controls the text track associated with a particular element is used as a child of the media elements element."]

properties.name: activeCues
properties.overview: A TextTrackCueList object listing the currently active set of text track cues. Track cues are active if the current playback position of the media is between the cues' start and end times. Thus, for displayed cues such as captions or subtitles, the active cues are currently being displayed.

properties.name: cues
properties.overview: A TextTrackCueList which contains all of the track's cues.

properties.name: id
properties.overview: A DOMString which identifies the track, if it has one. If it doesn't have an ID, then this value is an empty string (""). If the TextTrack is associated with a <track> element, then the track's ID matches the element's ID.

properties.name: inBandMetadataTrackDispatchType
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString which indicates the track's in-band metadata track dispatch type. needs details

properties.name: kind
properties.overview: Returns a DOMString indicating what kind of text track the TextTrack describes. The value must be one of those in the TextTrackKind enum.

properties.name: label
properties.overview: A human-readable DOMString which contains the text track's label, if one is present; otherwise, this is an empty string (""), in which case a custom label may need to be generated by your code using other attributes of the track, if the track's label needs to be exposed to the user.

properties.name: language
properties.overview: A DOMString which specifies the text language in which the text track's contents is written. The value must adhere to the format specified in the Tags for Identifying Languages (BCP 47) document from the IETF, just like the HTML lang attribute. For example, this can be "en-US" for United States English or "pt-BR" for Brazilian Portuguese.

properties.name: mode
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the track's current mode. Changing this property's value changes the track's current mode to match. Permitted values are listed under Text track mode constants. The default is disabled, unless the <track> element's default Boolean attribute is specified, in which case the default mode is started.

methods.name: addCue
methods.overview: Adds a cue (specified as a TextTrackCue object to the track's list of cues.

methods.name: removeCue
methods.overview: Removes a cue (specified as a TextTrackCue object from the track's list of cues.

name: TextTrackCue
overview: ["TextTrackCue is an abstract class which is used as the basis for the various derived cue types, such as VTTCue; you will instead work with those derived types. These cues represent a string of text that is presented for some duration of time during the performance of a TextTrack. The cue includes the start time (the time at which the text will be displayed) and the end time (the time at which it will be removed from the display), as well as other information."]

properties.name: endTime
properties.overview: A double that represents the video time that the cue will stop being displayed, in seconds.

properties.name: id
properties.overview: A DOMString that identifies the cue.

properties.name: onenter
properties.overview: The event handler for the enter event.

properties.name: onexit
properties.overview: The event handler for the exit event.

properties.name: pauseOnExit
properties.overview: A boolean for whether the video will pause when this cue stops being displayed.

properties.name: startTime
properties.overview: A double that represents the video time that the cue will start being displayed, in seconds.

properties.name: track
properties.overview: The TextTrack that this cue belongs to, or null if it doesn't belong to any.

name: TextTrackList
overview: ["The TextTrackList interface is used to represent a list of the text tracks defined by the element is used as a child of the media elements element, with each track represented by a separate textTrack object in the list.","Retrieve an instance of this object with HTMLMediaElement.textTracks. The individual tracks can be accessed using array syntax or functions such as forEach() for example."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: The number of tracks in the list.

properties.name: onaddtrack
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the addtrack event is fired, indicating that a new text track has been added to the media element.

properties.name: onchange
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the change event occurs.

properties.name: onremovetrack
properties.overview: An event handler to call when the removetrack event is sent, indicating that a text track has been removed from the media element.

methods.name: getTrackById
methods.overview: Returns the TextTrack found within the TextTrackList whose id matches the specified string. If no match is found, null is returned.

name: TimeRanges
overview: ["The TimeRanges interface is used to represent a set of time ranges, primarily for the purpose of tracking which portions of media have been buffered when loading it for use by the element is used to embed sound content in documents. It may contain one or more audio sources, represented using the src attribute or the element: the browser will choose the most suitable one. It can also be the destination for streamed media, using a MediaStream.\"><audio> and ) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document. You can use  elements.","A TimeRanges object includes one or more ranges of time, each specified by a starting and ending time offset. You reference each time range by using the start() and end() methods, passing the index number of the time range you want to retrieve.","The term \"normalized TimeRanges object\" indicates that ranges in such an object are ordered, don't overlap, aren't empty, and don't touch (adjacent ranges are folded into one bigger range)."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: Returns an unsigned long representing the number of time ranges represented by the time range object.

methods.name: end
methods.overview: Returns the time for the end of the specified range.

methods.name: start
methods.overview: Returns the time for the start of the range with the specified index.

name: TreeWalker
overview: ["The TreeWalker object represents the nodes of a document subtree and a position within them.","A TreeWalker can be created using the Document.createTreeWalker() method."]

properties.name: currentNode
properties.overview: Is the Node on which the TreeWalker is currently pointing at.

properties.name: filter
properties.overview: Returns a NodeFilter used to select the relevant nodes.

properties.name: root
properties.overview: Returns a Node representing the root node as specified when the TreeWalker was created.

properties.name: whatToShow
properties.overview:
Returns an unsigned long being a bitmask made of constants describing the types of Node that must be presented. Non-matching nodes are skipped, but their children may be included, if relevant. The possible values are:
Constant Numerical value Description
NodeFilter.SHOW_ALL -1 (that is the max value of unsigned long) Shows all nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_ATTRIBUTE 2 Shows attribute Attr nodes. This is meaningful only when creating a TreeWalker with an Attr node as its root. In this case, it means that the attribute node will appear in the first position of the iteration or traversal. Since attributes are never children of other nodes, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.
NodeFilter.SHOW_CDATA_SECTION 8 Shows CDATASection nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_COMMENT 128 Shows Comment nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT 256 Shows Document nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT 1024 Shows DocumentFragment nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT_TYPE 512 Shows DocumentType nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_ELEMENT 1 Shows Element nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_ENTITY 32 Shows Entity nodes. This is meaningful only when creating a TreeWalker with an Entity node as its root; in this case, it means that the Entity node will appear in the first position of the traversal. Since entities are not part of the document tree, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.
NodeFilter.SHOW_ENTITY_REFERENCE 16 Shows EntityReference nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_NOTATION 2048 Shows Notation nodes. This is meaningful only when creating a TreeWalker with a Notation node as its root; in this case, it means that the Notation node will appear in the first position of the traversal. Since entities are not part of the document tree, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.
NodeFilter.SHOW_PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION 64 Shows ProcessingInstruction nodes.
NodeFilter.SHOW_TEXT 4 Shows Text nodes.

methods.name: firstChild
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: lastChild
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, null is returned and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: nextNode
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to the next visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: nextSibling
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to its next sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. If there is no such node, null is returned and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: parentNode
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to the first visible ancestor node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: previousNode
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to the previous visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

methods.name: previousSibling
methods.overview: Moves the current Node to its previous sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. If there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

name: ValidityState
overview: ["The ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid."]

properties.name: badInput
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the user has provided input that the browser is unable to convert.

properties.name: customError
properties.overview: A Boolean indicating whether the element's custom validity message has been set to a non-empty string by calling the element's setCustomValidity() method.

properties.name: patternMismatch
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value does not match the specified pattern, and false if it does match. If true, the element matches the :invalid CSS pseudo-class.

properties.name: rangeOverflow
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value is greater than the maximum specified by the max attribute, or false if it is less than or equal to the maximum. If true, the element matches the :invalid and :out-of-range and CSS pseudo-classes.

properties.name: rangeUnderflow
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value is less than the minimum specified by the min attribute, or false if it is greater than or equal to the minimum. If true, the element matches the :invalid and :out-of-range CSS pseudo-classes.

properties.name: stepMismatch
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value does not fit the rules determined by the step attribute (that is, it's not evenly divisible by the step value), or false if it does fit the step rule. If true, the element matches the :invalid and :out-of-range CSS pseudo-classes.

properties.name: tooLong
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value exceeds the specified maxlength for HTMLInputElement or HTMLTextAreaElement objects, or false if its length is less than or equal to the maximum length. Note: This property is never true in Gecko, because elements' values are prevented from being longer than maxlength. If true, the element matches the the :invalid and :out-of-range CSS pseudo-classes.

properties.name: tooShort
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value fails to meet the specified minlength for HTMLInputElement or HTMLTextAreaElement objects, or false if its length is greater than or equal to the minimum length. If true, the element matches the :invalid and :out-of-range CSS pseudo-classes.

properties.name: typeMismatch
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the value is not in the required syntax (when type is email or url), or false if the syntax is correct. If true, the element matches the :invalid CSS pseudo-class.

properties.name: valid
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the element meets all its validation constraints, and is therefore considered to be valid, or false if it fails any constraint. If true, the element matches the :valid CSS pseudo-class; the :invalid CSS pseudo-class otherwise.

properties.name: valueMissing
properties.overview: A Boolean that is true if the element has a required attribute, but no value, or false otherwise. If true, the element matches the :invalid CSS pseudo-class.

name: VideoTrack
overview: ["The element.\">VideoTrack interface represents a single video track from a ) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document. You can use  element. The most common use for accessing a VideoTrack object is to toggle its selected property in order to make it the active video track for its ) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document. You can use  element."]

properties.name: id
properties.overview: A DOMString which uniquely identifies the track within the media. This ID can be used to locate a specific track within a video track list by calling VideoTrackList.getTrackById(). The ID can also be used as the fragment part of the URL if the media supports seeking by media fragment per the Media Fragments URI specification.

properties.name: kind
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the category into which the track falls. For example, the main video track would have a kind of "main".

properties.name: label
properties.overview: A DOMString providing a human-readable label for the track. For example, a track whose kind is "sign" might have a label of "A sign-language interpretation". This string is empty if no label is provided.

properties.name: language
properties.overview: A DOMString specifying the video track's primary language, or an empty string if unknown. The language is specified as a BCP 47 (RFC 5646) language code, such as "en-US" or "pt-BR".

properties.name: selected
properties.overview: A Boolean value which controls whether or not the video track is active. Only a single video track can be active at any given time, so setting this property to true for one track while another track is active will make that other track inactive.

name: VideoTrackList
overview: ["The VideoTrackList interface is used to represent a list of the video tracks contained within a ) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document. You can use  element, with each track represented by a separate element.\">VideoTrack object in the list.","Retrieve an instance of this object with HTMLMediaElement.videoTracks. The individual tracks can be accessed using array syntax or functions such as forEach() for example."]

properties.name: length
properties.overview: The number of tracks in the list.

properties.name: onaddtrack
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the addtrack event is fired, indicating that a new video track has been added to the media element.

properties.name: onchange
properties.overview: An event handler to be called when the change event occurs — that is, when the value of the selected property for a track has changed, due to the track being made active or inactive.

properties.name: onremovetrack
properties.overview: An event handler to call when the removetrack event is sent, indicating that a video track has been removed from the media element.

properties.name: selectedIndex
properties.overview: The index of the currently selected track, if any, or −1 otherwise.

methods.name: getTrackById
methods.overview: Returns the VideoTrack found within the VideoTrackList whose id matches the specified string. If no match is found, null is returned.

name: WindowEventHandlers
overview: ["The WindowEventHandlers mixin describes the event handlers common to several interfaces like Window, or elements.\">HTMLBodyElement and elements.\">HTMLFrameSetElement. Each of these interfaces can implement additional specific event handlers."]

properties.name: onafterprint
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the afterprint event is raised.

properties.name: onbeforeprint
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the beforeprint event is raised.

properties.name: onbeforeunload
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the beforeunload event is raised.

properties.name: onhashchange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the hashchange event is raised.

properties.name: onlanguagechange
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the languagechange event is raised.

properties.name: onmessage
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the message event is raised.

properties.name: onmessageerror
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the MessageError event is raised.

properties.name: onpopstate
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the popstate event is raised.

properties.name: onrejectionhandled
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the rejectionhandled event is raised, indicating that a Promise was rejected and the rejection has been handled.

properties.name: onstorage
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the storage event is raised.

properties.name: onunhandledrejection
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the unhandledrejection event is raised, indicating that a Promise was rejected but the rejection was not handled.

properties.name: onunload
properties.overview: Is an EventHandler representing the code to be called when the unload event is raised.

name: XMLDocument
overview: ["The XMLDocument interface represents an XML document. It inherits from the generic Document and does not add any specific methods or properties to it: nevertheless, several algorithms behave differently with the two types of documents."]

name: XMLSerializer
overview: ["The XMLSerializer interface provides the serializeToString() method to construct an XML string representing a DOM tree."]

methods.name: serializeToString
methods.overview: Returns the serialized subtree of a string.
